member.name: F:iMobileDevice.Afc.AfcApi.parent
member.summary: Backing field for the property

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.Afc.AfcApi.afc_client_new(iMobileDevice.iDevice.iDeviceHandle,iMobileDevice.Lockdown.LockdownServiceDescriptorHandle,iMobileDevice.Afc.AfcClientHandle@)
member.summary: Makes a connection to the AFC service on the device.
member.param: The device to connect to.
The service descriptor returned by lockdownd_start_service.
Pointer that will be set to a newly allocated afc_client_t upon successful return.
member.returns: AFC_E_SUCCESS on success, AFC_E_INVALID_ARG if device or service is invalid, AFC_E_MUX_ERROR if the connection cannot be established, or AFC_E_NO_MEM if there is a memory allocation problem.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.Afc.AfcApi.afc_client_start_service(iMobileDevice.iDevice.iDeviceHandle,iMobileDevice.Afc.AfcClientHandle@,System.String)
member.summary: Starts a new AFC service on the specified device and connects to it.
member.param: The device to connect to.
Pointer that will point to a newly allocated afc_client_t upon successful return. Must be freed using afc_client_free() after use.
The label to use for communication. Usually the program name. Pass NULL to disable sending the label in requests to lockdownd.
member.returns: AFC_E_SUCCESS on success, or an AFC_E_* error code otherwise.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.Afc.AfcApi.afc_client_free(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Frees up an AFC client. If the connection was created by the client itself, the connection will be closed.
member.param: The client to free.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.Afc.AfcApi.afc_get_device_info(iMobileDevice.Afc.AfcClientHandle,System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection{System.String}@)
member.summary: Get device information for a connected client. The device information returned is the device model as well as the free space, the total capacity and blocksize on the accessed disk partition.
member.param: The client to get device info for.
A char list of device information terminated by an empty string or NULL if there was an error. Free with afc_dictionary_free().
member.returns: AFC_E_SUCCESS on success or an AFC_E_* error value.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.Afc.AfcApi.afc_read_directory(iMobileDevice.Afc.AfcClientHandle,System.String,System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection{System.String}@)
member.summary: Gets a directory listing of the directory requested.
member.param: The client to get a directory listing from.
The directory for listing. (must be a fully-qualified path)
A char list of files in the directory terminated by an empty string or NULL if there was an error. Free with afc_dictionary_free().
member.returns: AFC_E_SUCCESS on success or an AFC_E_* error value.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.Afc.AfcApi.afc_get_file_info(iMobileDevice.Afc.AfcClientHandle,System.String,System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection{System.String}@)
member.summary: Gets information about a specific file.
member.param: The client to use to get the information of the file.
The fully-qualified path to the file.
Pointer to a buffer that will be filled with a NULL-terminated list of strings with the file information. Set to NULL before calling this function. Free with afc_dictionary_free().
member.returns: AFC_E_SUCCESS on success or an AFC_E_* error value.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.Afc.AfcApi.afc_file_open(iMobileDevice.Afc.AfcClientHandle,System.String,iMobileDevice.Afc.AfcFileMode,System.UInt64@)
member.summary: Opens a file on the device.
member.param: The client to use to open the file.
The file to open. (must be a fully-qualified path)
The mode to use to open the file.
Pointer to a uint64_t that will hold the handle of the file
member.returns: AFC_E_SUCCESS on success or an AFC_E_* error value.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.Afc.AfcApi.afc_file_close(iMobileDevice.Afc.AfcClientHandle,System.UInt64)
member.summary: Closes a file on the device.
member.param: The client to close the file with.
File handle of a previously opened file.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.Afc.AfcApi.afc_file_lock(iMobileDevice.Afc.AfcClientHandle,System.UInt64,iMobileDevice.Afc.AfcLockOp)
member.summary: Locks or unlocks a file on the device. Makes use of flock on the device.
member.param: The client to lock the file with.
File handle of a previously opened file.
the lock or unlock operation to perform, this is one of AFC_LOCK_SH (shared lock), AFC_LOCK_EX (exclusive lock), or AFC_LOCK_UN (unlock).

The number of bytes to read
The number of bytes actually read.

Position in bytes of indicator

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.Afc.AfcApi.afc_file_truncate(iMobileDevice.Afc.AfcClientHandle,System.UInt64,System.UInt64)

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.Afc.IAfcApi.afc_get_device_info(iMobileDevice.Afc.AfcClientHandle,System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection{System.String}@)
member.summary: Get device information for a connected client. The device information returned is the device model as well as the free space, the total capacity and blocksize on the accessed disk partition.
member.param: The client to get device info for.
A char list of device information terminated by an empty string or NULL if there was an error. Free with afc_dictionary_free().
member.returns: AFC_E_SUCCESS on success or an AFC_E_* error value.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.Afc.IAfcApi.afc_read_directory(iMobileDevice.Afc.AfcClientHandle,System.String,System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection{System.String}@)
member.summary: Gets a directory listing of the directory requested.
member.param: The client to get a directory listing from.
The directory for listing. (must be a fully-qualified path)
A char list of files in the directory terminated by an empty string or NULL if there was an error. Free with afc_dictionary_free().
member.returns: AFC_E_SUCCESS on success or an AFC_E_* error value.

member.summary: Gets information about a specific file.
member.param: The client to use to get the information of the file.
The fully-qualified path to the file.
Pointer to a buffer that will be filled with a NULL-terminated list of strings with the file information. Set to NULL before calling this function. Free with afc_dictionary_free().

Pointer to a uint64_t that will hold the handle of the file

member.summary: Closes a file on the device.

File handle of a previously opened file.

member.summary: Connects to the debugserver service on the specified device.

The service descriptor returned by lockdownd_start_service.
Pointer that will point to a newly allocated debugserver_client_t upon successful return. Must be freed using debugserver_client_free() after use.

Pointer that will point to a newly allocated debugserver_client_t upon successful return. Must be freed using debugserver_client_free() after use.
The label to use for communication. Usually the program name. Pass NULL to disable sending the label in requests to lockdownd.
member.returns: DEBUGSERVER_E_SUCCESS on success, or an DEBUGSERVER_E_* error code otherwise.

A binary flag combination of DIAGNOSTICS_RELAY_ACTION_FLAG_WAIT_FOR_DISCONNECT to wait until diagnostics_relay_client_free() disconnects before execution and DIAGNOSTICS_RELAY_ACTION_FLAG_DISPLAY_FAIL to show a "FAIL" dialog or DIAGNOSTICS_RELAY_ACTION_FLAG_DISPLAY_PASS to show an "OK" dialog
member.returns: DIAGNOSTICS_RELAY_E_SUCCESS on success, DIAGNOSTICS_RELAY_E_INVALID_ARG when client is NULL, DIAGNOSTICS_RELAY_E_PLIST_ERROR if the device did not acknowledge the request

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.DiagnosticsRelay.IDiagnosticsRelayApi.diagnostics_relay_shutdown(iMobileDevice.DiagnosticsRelay.DiagnosticsRelayClientHandle,iMobileDevice.DiagnosticsRelay.DiagnosticsRelayAction)

member.returns: DIAGNOSTICS_RELAY_E_SUCCESS on success, DIAGNOSTICS_RELAY_E_INVALID_ARG when client is NULL, DIAGNOSTICS_RELAY_E_PLIST_ERROR if the device did not acknowledge the request

member.name: T:iMobileDevice.DlOpenFlags
member.summary: Specifies how the function loads a dynamic link library.

member.name: F:iMobileDevice.DlOpenFlags.RTLD_LAZY
member.summary: Perform lazy binding. Only resolve symbols as the code that references them is executed. If the symbol is never referenced, then it is never resolved. (Lazy binding is only performed for function references; references to variables are always immediately bound when the library is loaded.)

member.name: F:iMobileDevice.DlOpenFlags.RTLD_NOW
member.summary: If this value is specified, or the environment variable LD_BIND_NOW is set to a nonempty string, all undefined symbols in the library are resolved before returns. If this cannot be done, an error is returned.

member.name: F:iMobileDevice.DlOpenFlags.RTLD_GLOBAL
member.summary: The symbols defined by this library will be made available for symbol resolution of subsequently loaded libraries.

member.name: F:iMobileDevice.DlOpenFlags.RTLD_LOCAL
member.summary: This is the converse of , and the default if neither flag is specified. Symbols defined in this library are not made available to resolve references in subsequently loaded libraries.

member.name: F:iMobileDevice.DlOpenFlags.RTLD_NODELETE
member.summary: Do not unload the library during . Consequently, the library's static variables are not reinitialized if the library is reloaded with at a later time.
member.remarks: This flag is not specified in POSIX.1-2001.

member.name: F:iMobileDevice.DlOpenFlags.RTLD_NOLOAD
member.summary: Don't load the library. This can be used to test if the library is already resident ( returns if it is not, or the library's handle if it is resident). This flag can also be used to promote the flags on a library that is already loaded. For example, a library that was previously loaded with can be reopened with | .
member.remarks: This flag is not specified in POSIX.1-2001.

member.name: F:iMobileDevice.DlOpenFlags.RTLD_DEEPBIND
member.summary: Place the lookup scope of the symbols in this library ahead of the global scope. This means that a self-contained library will use its own symbols in preference to global symbols with the same name contained in libraries that have already been loaded.
member.remarks: This flag is not specified in POSIX.1-2001.

member.name: F:iMobileDevice.FileRelay.FileRelayApi.parent
member.summary: Backing field for the property

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.FileRelay.FileRelayApi.file_relay_client_new(iMobileDevice.iDevice.iDeviceHandle,iMobileDevice.Lockdown.LockdownServiceDescriptorHandle,iMobileDevice.FileRelay.FileRelayClientHandle@)
member.summary: Connects to the file_relay service on the specified device.
member.param: The device to connect to.
The service descriptor returned by lockdownd_start_service.
Reference that will point to a newly allocated file_relay_client_t upon successful return.
member.returns: FILE_RELAY_E_SUCCESS on success, FILE_RELAY_E_INVALID_ARG when one of the parameters is invalid, or FILE_RELAY_E_MUX_ERROR when the connection failed.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.FileRelay.FileRelayApi.file_relay_client_start_service(iMobileDevice.iDevice.iDeviceHandle,iMobileDevice.FileRelay.FileRelayClientHandle@,System.String)
member.summary: Starts a new file_relay service on the specified device and connects to it.
member.param: The device to connect to.
Pointer that will point to a newly allocated file_relay_client_t upon successful return. Must be freed using file_relay_client_free() after use.
The label to use for communication. Usually the program name. Pass NULL to disable sending the label in requests to lockdownd.
member.returns: FILE_RELAY_E_SUCCESS on success, or an FILE_RELAY_E_* error code otherwise.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.FileRelay.FileRelayApi.file_relay_client_free(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Disconnects a file_relay client from the device and frees up the file_relay client data.
member.param: The file_relay client to disconnect and free.
member.returns: FILE_RELAY_E_SUCCESS on success, FILE_RELAY_E_INVALID_ARG when one of client or client->parent is invalid, or FILE_RELAY_E_UNKNOWN_ERROR when the was an error freeing the parent property_list_service client.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.FileRelay.FileRelayApi.file_relay_request_sources(iMobileDevice.FileRelay.FileRelayClientHandle,System.String@,iMobileDevice.iDevice.iDeviceConnectionHandle@)
member.summary: Request data for the given sources.
member.param: The connected file_relay client.
A NULL-terminated list of sources to retrieve. Valid sources are: - AppleSupport - Network - VPN - WiFi - UserDatabases - CrashReporter - tmp - SystemConfiguration

The connection that has to be used for receiving the data using idevice_connection_receive(). The connection will be closed automatically by the device, but use file_relay_client_free() to clean up properly.
Maximum time in milliseconds to wait for data.
member.returns: FILE_RELAY_E_SUCCESS on succes, FILE_RELAY_E_INVALID_ARG when one or more parameters are invalid, FILE_RELAY_E_MUX_ERROR if a communication error occurs, FILE_RELAY_E_PLIST_ERROR when the received result is NULL or is not a valid plist, FILE_RELAY_E_INVALID_SOURCE if one or more sources are invalid, FILE_RELAY_E_STAGING_EMPTY if no data is available for the given sources, or FILE_RELAY_E_UNKNOWN_ERROR otherwise.
member.remarks: WARNING: Don't call this function without reading the data afterwards. A directory mobile_file_relay.XXXX used for creating the archive will remain in the /tmp directory otherwise.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.FileRelay.FileRelayApi.file_relay_request_sources_timeout(iMobileDevice.FileRelay.FileRelayClientHandle,System.String@,iMobileDevice.iDevice.iDeviceConnectionHandle@,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Request data for the given sources. Calls file_relay_request_sources_timeout() with a timeout of 60000 milliseconds (60 seconds).
member.param: The connected file_relay client.
A NULL-terminated list of sources to retrieve. Valid sources are: - AppleSupport - Network - VPN - WiFi - UserDatabases - CrashReporter - tmp - SystemConfiguration

The connection that has to be used for receiving the data using idevice_connection_receive(). The connection will be closed automatically by the device, but use file_relay_client_free() to clean up properly.
member.returns: FILE_RELAY_E_SUCCESS on succes, FILE_RELAY_E_INVALID_ARG when one or more parameters are invalid, FILE_RELAY_E_MUX_ERROR if a communication error occurs, FILE_RELAY_E_PLIST_ERROR when the received result is NULL or is not a valid plist, FILE_RELAY_E_INVALID_SOURCE if one or more sources are invalid, FILE_RELAY_E_STAGING_EMPTY if no data is available for the given sources, or FILE_RELAY_E_UNKNOWN_ERROR otherwise.
member.remarks: WARNING: Don't call this function without reading the data afterwards. A directory mobile_file_relay.XXXX used for creating the archive will remain in the /tmp directory otherwise.

A NULL-terminated list of sources to retrieve. Valid sources are: - AppleSupport - Network - VPN - WiFi - UserDatabases - CrashReporter - tmp - SystemConfiguration

Maximum time in milliseconds to wait for data.

member.remarks: WARNING: Don't call this function without reading the data afterwards. A directory mobile_file_relay.XXXX used for creating the archive will remain in the /tmp directory otherwise.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.HouseArrest.HouseArrestApi.house_arrest_send_request(iMobileDevice.HouseArrest.HouseArrestClientHandle,iMobileDevice.Plist.PlistHandle)
member.summary: Sends a generic request to the connected house_arrest service.
member.param: The house_arrest client to use.
The request to send as a plist of type PLIST_DICT.
member.returns: HOUSE_ARREST_E_SUCCESS if the request was successfully sent, HOUSE_ARREST_E_INVALID_ARG if client or dict is invalid, HOUSE_ARREST_E_PLIST_ERROR if dict is not a plist of type PLIST_DICT, HOUSE_ARREST_E_INVALID_MODE if the client is not in the correct mode, or HOUSE_ARREST_E_CONN_FAILED if a connection error occured.
member.remarks: If this function returns HOUSE_ARREST_E_SUCCESS it does not mean that the request was successful. To check for success or failure you need to call house_arrest_get_result().

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.HouseArrest.HouseArrestApi.house_arrest_send_command(iMobileDevice.HouseArrest.HouseArrestClientHandle,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Send a command to the connected house_arrest service. Calls house_arrest_send_request() internally.
member.param: The house_arrest client to use.
The command to send. Currently, only VendContainer and VendDocuments are known.
The application identifier to pass along with the .
member.returns: HOUSE_ARREST_E_SUCCESS if the command was successfully sent, HOUSE_ARREST_E_INVALID_ARG if client, command, or appid is invalid, HOUSE_ARREST_E_INVALID_MODE if the client is not in the correct mode, or HOUSE_ARREST_E_CONN_FAILED if a connection error occured.
member.remarks: If this function returns HOUSE_ARREST_E_SUCCESS it does not mean that the command was successful. To check for success or failure you need to call house_arrest_get_result().

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.HouseArrest.HouseArrestApi.house_arrest_get_result(iMobileDevice.HouseArrest.HouseArrestClientHandle,iMobileDevice.Plist.PlistHandle@)
member.summary: Retrieves the result of a previously sent house_arrest_request_* request.
member.param: The house_arrest client to use

Pointer that will be set to a plist containing the result to the last performed operation. It holds a key 'Status' with the value 'Complete' on success or a key 'Error' with an error description as value. The caller is responsible for freeing the returned plist.
member.returns: HOUSE_ARREST_E_SUCCESS if a result plist was retrieved, HOUSE_ARREST_E_INVALID_ARG if client is invalid, HOUSE_ARREST_E_INVALID_MODE if the client is not in the correct mode, or HOUSE_ARREST_E_CONN_FAILED if a connection error occured.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.HouseArrest.HouseArrestApi.afc_client_new_from_house_arrest_client(iMobileDevice.HouseArrest.HouseArrestClientHandle,iMobileDevice.Afc.AfcClientHandle@)
member.summary: Creates an AFC client using the given house_arrest client's connection allowing file access to a specific application directory requested by functions like house_arrest_request_vendor_documents().
member.param: The house_arrest client to use.
Pointer that will be set to a newly allocated afc_client_t upon successful return.
member.returns: AFC_E_SUCCESS if the afc client was successfully created, AFC_E_INVALID_ARG if client is invalid or was already used to create an afc client, or an AFC_E_* error code returned by afc_client_new_with_service_client().
member.remarks: After calling this function the house_arrest client will go in an AFC mode that will only allow calling house_arrest_client_free(). Only call house_arrest_client_free() if all AFC operations have completed since it will close the connection.

Application-specific data passed as parameter to the registered callback function.
member.returns: IDEVICE_E_SUCCESS on success or an error value when an error occured.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.iDevice.iDeviceApi.idevice_event_unsubscribe
member.summary: Release the event callback function that has been registered with idevice_event_subscribe().
member.returns: IDEVICE_E_SUCCESS on success or an error value when an error occured.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.iDevice.iDeviceApi.idevice_get_device_list(System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection{System.String}@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Get a list of currently available devices.

Number of devices found.
member.returns: IDEVICE_E_SUCCESS on success or an error value when an error occured.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.iDevice.iDeviceApi.idevice_device_list_free(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Free a list of device udids.

member.returns: Always returnes IDEVICE_E_SUCCESS.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.iDevice.iDeviceApi.idevice_new(iMobileDevice.iDevice.iDeviceHandle@,System.String)
member.summary: Creates an idevice_t structure for the device specified by udid, if the device is available.
member.param: Upon calling this function, a pointer to a location of type idevice_t. On successful return, this location will be populated.
The UDID to match.
member.returns: IDEVICE_E_SUCCESS if ok, otherwise an error code.
member.remarks: The resulting idevice_t structure has to be freed with idevice_free() if it is no longer used.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.iDevice.iDeviceApi.idevice_free(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Cleans up an idevice structure, then frees the structure itself. This is a library-level function; deals directly with the device to tear down relations, but otherwise is mostly internal.
member.param: idevice_t to free.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.iDevice.iDeviceApi.idevice_connect(iMobileDevice.iDevice.iDeviceHandle,System.UInt16,iMobileDevice.iDevice.iDeviceConnectionHandle@)
member.summary: Set up a connection to the given device.
member.param: The device to connect to.
The destination port to connect to.
Pointer to an idevice_connection_t that will be filled with the necessary data of the connection.
member.returns: IDEVICE_E_SUCCESS if ok, otherwise an error code.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.iDevice.iDeviceApi.idevice_disconnect(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Disconnect from the device and clean up the connection structure.
member.param: The connection to close.
member.returns: IDEVICE_E_SUCCESS if ok, otherwise an error code.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.iDevice.iDeviceApi.idevice_connection_send(iMobileDevice.iDevice.iDeviceConnectionHandle,System.Byte[],System.UInt32,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Send data to a device via the given connection.
member.param: The connection to send data over.
Buffer with data to send.
Size of the buffer to send.
Pointer to an uint32_t that will be filled with the number of bytes actually sent.
member.returns: IDEVICE_E_SUCCESS if ok, otherwise an error code.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.iDevice.iDeviceApi.idevice_connection_receive_timeout(iMobileDevice.iDevice.iDeviceConnectionHandle,System.Byte[],System.UInt32,System.UInt32@,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Receive data from a device via the given connection. This function will return after the given timeout even if no data has been received.
member.param: The connection to receive data from.
Buffer that will be filled with the received data. This buffer has to be large enough to hold len bytes.
Buffer size or number of bytes to receive.
Number of bytes actually received.
Timeout in milliseconds after which this function should return even if no data has been received.
member.returns: IDEVICE_E_SUCCESS if ok, otherwise an error code.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.iDevice.iDeviceApi.idevice_connection_receive(iMobileDevice.iDevice.iDeviceConnectionHandle,System.Byte[],System.UInt32,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Receive data from a device via the given connection. This function is like idevice_connection_receive_timeout, but with a predefined reasonable timeout.
member.param: The connection to receive data from.
Buffer that will be filled with the received data. This buffer has to be large enough to hold len bytes.
Buffer size or number of bytes to receive.
Number of bytes actually received.
member.returns: IDEVICE_E_SUCCESS if ok, otherwise an error code.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.iDevice.iDeviceApi.idevice_connection_enable_ssl(iMobileDevice.iDevice.iDeviceConnectionHandle)
member.summary: Enables SSL for the given connection.
member.param: The connection to enable SSL for.
member.returns: IDEVICE_E_SUCCESS on success, IDEVICE_E_INVALID_ARG when connection is NULL or connection->ssl_data is non-NULL, or IDEVICE_E_SSL_ERROR when SSL initialization, setup, or handshake fails.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.iDevice.iDeviceApi.idevice_connection_disable_ssl(iMobileDevice.iDevice.iDeviceConnectionHandle)
member.summary: Disable SSL for the given connection.
member.param: The connection to disable SSL for.
member.returns: IDEVICE_E_SUCCESS on success, IDEVICE_E_INVALID_ARG when connection is NULL. This function also returns IDEVICE_E_SUCCESS when SSL is not enabled and does no further error checking on cleanup.

member.returns: IDEVICE_E_SUCCESS if ok, otherwise an error code.

The port to which to connect

member.summary: specifies how libusbmuxd should connect to usbmuxd

member.name: P:iMobileDevice.iDevice.IiDeviceApi.Parent
member.summary: Gets or sets the which owns this .

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.iDevice.IiDeviceApi.idevice_set_debug_callback(iMobileDevice.iDevice.iDeviceDebugCallBack)
member.summary: Sets the callback to invoke when writing out debug messages. If this callback is set, messages will be written to this callback instead of the standard output.
member.param: The callback which will receive the debug messages. Set to NULL to redirect to stdout.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.iDevice.IiDeviceApi.idevice_set_debug_level(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the level of debugging.
member.param: Set to 0 for no debug output, 1 to enable basic debug output and 2 to enable full debug output. When set to 2, the values of buffers being sent across the wire are printed out as well, this results in very verbose output.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.iDevice.IiDeviceApi.idevice_event_subscribe(iMobileDevice.iDevice.iDeviceEventCallBack,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Register a callback function that will be called when device add/remove events occur.
member.param: Callback function to call.
Application-specific data passed as parameter to the registered callback function.
member.returns: IDEVICE_E_SUCCESS on success or an error value when an error occured.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.iDevice.IiDeviceApi.idevice_event_unsubscribe
member.summary: Release the event callback function that has been registered with idevice_event_subscribe().
member.returns: IDEVICE_E_SUCCESS on success or an error value when an error occured.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.iDevice.IiDeviceApi.idevice_get_device_list(System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection{System.String}@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Get a list of currently available devices.
member.param: List of udids of devices that are currently available. This list is terminated by a NULL pointer.
Number of devices found.
member.returns: IDEVICE_E_SUCCESS on success or an error value when an error occured.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.iDevice.IiDeviceApi.idevice_device_list_free(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Free a list of device udids.
member.param: List of udids to free.
member.returns: Always returnes IDEVICE_E_SUCCESS.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.iDevice.IiDeviceApi.idevice_new(iMobileDevice.iDevice.iDeviceHandle@,System.String)
member.summary: Creates an idevice_t structure for the device specified by udid, if the device is available.
member.param: Upon calling this function, a pointer to a location of type idevice_t. On successful return, this location will be populated.
The UDID to match.
member.returns: IDEVICE_E_SUCCESS if ok, otherwise an error code.
member.remarks: The resulting idevice_t structure has to be freed with idevice_free() if it is no longer used.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.iDevice.IiDeviceApi.idevice_free(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Cleans up an idevice structure, then frees the structure itself. This is a library-level function; deals directly with the device to tear down relations, but otherwise is mostly internal.
member.param: idevice_t to free.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.iDevice.IiDeviceApi.idevice_connect(iMobileDevice.iDevice.iDeviceHandle,System.UInt16,iMobileDevice.iDevice.iDeviceConnectionHandle@)
member.summary: Set up a connection to the given device.
member.param: The device to connect to.
The destination port to connect to.
Pointer to an idevice_connection_t that will be filled with the necessary data of the connection.
member.returns: IDEVICE_E_SUCCESS if ok, otherwise an error code.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.iDevice.IiDeviceApi.idevice_disconnect(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Disconnect from the device and clean up the connection structure.
member.param: The connection to close.
member.returns: IDEVICE_E_SUCCESS if ok, otherwise an error code.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.iDevice.IiDeviceApi.idevice_connection_send(iMobileDevice.iDevice.iDeviceConnectionHandle,System.Byte[],System.UInt32,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Send data to a device via the given connection.
member.param: The connection to send data over.
Buffer with data to send.
Size of the buffer to send.
Pointer to an uint32_t that will be filled with the number of bytes actually sent.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.iDevice.IiDeviceApi.idevice_connection_receive_timeout(iMobileDevice.iDevice.iDeviceConnectionHandle,System.Byte[],System.UInt32,System.UInt32@,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Receive data from a device via the given connection. This function will return after the given timeout even if no data has been received.
member.param: The connection to receive data from.
Buffer that will be filled with the received data. This buffer has to be large enough to hold len bytes.
Buffer size or number of bytes to receive.
Number of bytes actually received.
Timeout in milliseconds after which this function should return even if no data has been received.
member.returns: IDEVICE_E_SUCCESS if ok, otherwise an error code.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.iDevice.IiDeviceApi.idevice_connection_receive(iMobileDevice.iDevice.iDeviceConnectionHandle,System.Byte[],System.UInt32,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Receive data from a device via the given connection. This function is like idevice_connection_receive_timeout, but with a predefined reasonable timeout.
member.param: The connection to receive data from.
Buffer that will be filled with the received data. This buffer has to be large enough to hold len bytes.
Buffer size or number of bytes to receive.
Number of bytes actually received.
member.returns: IDEVICE_E_SUCCESS if ok, otherwise an error code.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.iDevice.IiDeviceApi.idevice_connection_enable_ssl(iMobileDevice.iDevice.iDeviceConnectionHandle)

member.param: The connection to enable SSL for.
member.returns: IDEVICE_E_SUCCESS on success, IDEVICE_E_INVALID_ARG when connection is NULL or connection->ssl_data is non-NULL, or IDEVICE_E_SSL_ERROR when SSL initialization, setup, or handshake fails.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.iDevice.IiDeviceApi.idevice_connection_disable_ssl(iMobileDevice.iDevice.iDeviceConnectionHandle)
member.summary: Disable SSL for the given connection.
member.param: The connection to disable SSL for.
member.returns: IDEVICE_E_SUCCESS on success, IDEVICE_E_INVALID_ARG when connection is NULL. This function also returns IDEVICE_E_SUCCESS when SSL is not enabled and does no further error checking on cleanup.

member.summary: Connects to the installation_proxy service on the specified device.

The service descriptor returned by lockdownd_start_service.
Pointer that will be set to a newly allocated instproxy_client_t upon successful return.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.InstallationProxy.IInstallationProxyApi.instproxy_client_start_service(iMobileDevice.iDevice.iDeviceHandle,iMobileDevice.InstallationProxy.InstallationProxyClientHandle@,System.String)
member.summary: Starts a new installation_proxy service on the specified device and connects to it.
member.param: The device to connect to.
Pointer that will point to a newly allocated instproxy_client_t upon successful return. Must be freed using instproxy_client_free() after use.
The label to use for communication. Usually the program name. Pass NULL to disable sending the label in requests to lockdownd.

member.summary: Disconnects an installation_proxy client from the device and frees up the installation_proxy client data.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.InstallationProxy.IInstallationProxyApi.instproxy_browse(iMobileDevice.InstallationProxy.InstallationProxyClientHandle,iMobileDevice.Plist.PlistHandle,iMobileDevice.Plist.PlistHandle@)
member.summary: List installed applications. This function runs synchronously.
member.param: The connected installation_proxy client
The client options to use, as PLIST_DICT, or NULL. Valid client options include: "ApplicationType" -> "System" "ApplicationType" -> "User" "ApplicationType" -> "Internal" "ApplicationType" -> "Any"
Pointer that will be set to a plist that will hold an array of PLIST_DICT holding information about the applications found.
member.returns: INSTPROXY_E_SUCCESS on success or an INSTPROXY_E_* error value if an error occured.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.InstallationProxy.IInstallationProxyApi.instproxy_browse_with_callback(iMobileDevice.InstallationProxy.InstallationProxyClientHandle,iMobileDevice.Plist.PlistHandle,iMobileDevice.InstallationProxy.InstallationProxyStatusCallBack,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: List pages of installed applications in a callback.
member.param: The connected installation_proxy client
The client options to use, as PLIST_DICT, or NULL. Valid client options include: "ApplicationType" -> "System" "ApplicationType" -> "User" "ApplicationType" -> "Internal" "ApplicationType" -> "Any"
Callback function to process each page of application information. Passing a callback is required.
Callback data passed to status_cb.
member.returns: INSTPROXY_E_SUCCESS on success or an INSTPROXY_E_* error value if an error occured.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.InstallationProxy.IInstallationProxyApi.instproxy_lookup(iMobileDevice.InstallationProxy.InstallationProxyClientHandle,System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection{System.String},iMobileDevice.Plist.PlistHandle,iMobileDevice.Plist.PlistHandle@)
member.summary: Lookup information about specific applications from the device.
member.param: The connected installation_proxy client
An array of bundle identifiers that MUST have a terminating NULL entry or NULL to lookup all.
The client options to use, as PLIST_DICT, or NULL. Currently there are no known client options, so pass NULL here.
Pointer that will be set to a plist containing a PLIST_DICT holding requested information about the application or NULL on errors.
member.returns: INSTPROXY_E_SUCCESS on success or an INSTPROXY_E_* error value if an error occured.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.InstallationProxy.IInstallationProxyApi.instproxy_install(iMobileDevice.InstallationProxy.InstallationProxyClientHandle,System.String,iMobileDevice.Plist.PlistHandle,iMobileDevice.InstallationProxy.InstallationProxyStatusCallBack,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Install an application on the device.
member.param: The connected installation_proxy client
Path of the installation package (inside the AFC jail)

The client options to use, as PLIST_DICT, or NULL. Valid options include: "iTunesMetadata" -> PLIST_DATA "ApplicationSINF" -> PLIST_DATA "PackageType" -> "Developer" If PackageType -> Developer is specified, then pkg_path points to an .app directory instead of an install package.
Callback function for progress and status information. If NULL is passed, this function will run synchronously.
Callback data passed to status_cb.
member.returns: INSTPROXY_E_SUCCESS on success or an INSTPROXY_E_* error value if an error occured.
member.remarks: If a callback function is given (async mode), this function returns INSTPROXY_E_SUCCESS immediately if the status updater thread has been created successfully; any error occuring during the command has to be handled inside the specified callback function.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.InstallationProxy.IInstallationProxyApi.instproxy_upgrade(iMobileDevice.InstallationProxy.InstallationProxyClientHandle,System.String,iMobileDevice.Plist.PlistHandle,iMobileDevice.InstallationProxy.InstallationProxyStatusCallBack,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Upgrade an application on the device. This function is nearly the same as instproxy_install; the difference is that the installation progress on the device is faster if the application is already installed.
member.param: The connected installation_proxy client
Path of the installation package (inside the AFC jail)

The client options to use, as PLIST_DICT, or NULL. Valid options include: "iTunesMetadata" -> PLIST_DATA "ApplicationSINF" -> PLIST_DATA "PackageType" -> "Developer" If PackageType -> Developer is specified, then pkg_path points to an .app directory instead of an install package.
Callback function for progress and status information. If NULL is passed, this function will run synchronously.
Callback data passed to status_cb.
member.returns: INSTPROXY_E_SUCCESS on success or an INSTPROXY_E_* error value if an error occured.
member.remarks: If a callback function is given (async mode), this function returns INSTPROXY_E_SUCCESS immediately if the status updater thread has been created successfully; any error occuring during the command has to be handled inside the specified callback function.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.InstallationProxy.IInstallationProxyApi.instproxy_uninstall(iMobileDevice.InstallationProxy.InstallationProxyClientHandle,System.String,iMobileDevice.Plist.PlistHandle,iMobileDevice.InstallationProxy.InstallationProxyStatusCallBack,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Uninstall an application from the device.
member.param: The connected installation proxy client
ApplicationIdentifier of the app to uninstall
The client options to use, as PLIST_DICT, or NULL. Currently there are no known client options, so pass NULL here.
Callback function for progress and status information. If NULL is passed, this function will run synchronously.
Callback data passed to status_cb.
member.returns: INSTPROXY_E_SUCCESS on success or an INSTPROXY_E_* error value if an error occured.
member.remarks: If a callback function is given (async mode), this function returns INSTPROXY_E_SUCCESS immediately if the status updater thread has been created successfully; any error occuring during the command has to be handled inside the specified callback function.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.InstallationProxy.IInstallationProxyApi.instproxy_lookup_archives(iMobileDevice.InstallationProxy.InstallationProxyClientHandle,iMobileDevice.Plist.PlistHandle,iMobileDevice.Plist.PlistHandle@)
member.summary: List archived applications. This function runs synchronously.
member.param: The connected installation_proxy client
The client options to use, as PLIST_DICT, or NULL. Currently there are no known client options, so pass NULL here.
Pointer that will be set to a plist containing a PLIST_DICT holding information about the archived applications found.
member.returns: INSTPROXY_E_SUCCESS on success or an INSTPROXY_E_* error value if an error occured.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.InstallationProxy.IInstallationProxyApi.instproxy_archive(iMobileDevice.InstallationProxy.InstallationProxyClientHandle,System.String,iMobileDevice.Plist.PlistHandle,iMobileDevice.InstallationProxy.InstallationProxyStatusCallBack,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Archive an application on the device. This function tells the device to make an archive of the specified application. This results in the device creating a ZIP archive in the 'ApplicationArchives' directory and uninstalling the application.
member.param: The connected installation proxy client
ApplicationIdentifier of the app to archive.
The client options to use, as PLIST_DICT, or NULL. Valid options include: "SkipUninstall" -> Boolean "ArchiveType" -> "ApplicationOnly"
Callback function for progress and status information. If NULL is passed, this function will run synchronously.
Callback data passed to status_cb.
member.returns: INSTPROXY_E_SUCCESS on success or an INSTPROXY_E_* error value if an error occured.
member.remarks: If a callback function is given (async mode), this function returns INSTPROXY_E_SUCCESS immediately if the status updater thread has been created successfully; any error occuring during the command has to be handled inside the specified callback function.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.InstallationProxy.IInstallationProxyApi.instproxy_restore(iMobileDevice.InstallationProxy.InstallationProxyClientHandle,System.String,iMobileDevice.Plist.PlistHandle,iMobileDevice.InstallationProxy.InstallationProxyStatusCallBack,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Restore a previously archived application on the device. This function is the counterpart to instproxy_archive.
member.param: The connected installation proxy client
ApplicationIdentifier of the app to restore.
The client options to use, as PLIST_DICT, or NULL. Valid options include: "ArchiveType" -> "DocumentsOnly"
Callback function for progress and status information. If NULL is passed, this function will run synchronously.
Callback data passed to status_cb.
member.returns: INSTPROXY_E_SUCCESS on success or an INSTPROXY_E_* error value if an error occured.
member.remarks: If a callback function is given (async mode), this function returns INSTPROXY_E_SUCCESS immediately if the status updater thread has been created successfully; any error occuring during the command has to be handled inside the specified callback function.

member.summary: Removes a previously archived application from the device. This function removes the ZIP archive from the 'ApplicationArchives' directory.
member.param: The connected installation proxy client
ApplicationIdentifier of the archived app to remove.
The client options to use, as PLIST_DICT, or NULL. Currently there are no known client options, so passing NULL is fine.
Callback function for progress and status information. If NULL is passed, this function will run synchronously.
Callback data passed to status_cb.
member.returns: INSTPROXY_E_SUCCESS on success or an INSTPROXY_E_* error value if an error occured.
member.remarks: If a callback function is given (async mode), this function returns INSTPROXY_E_SUCCESS immediately if the status updater thread has been created successfully; any error occuring during the command has to be handled inside the specified callback function.

The client options to use, as PLIST_DICT, or NULL. Valid client options include: "ApplicationType" -> "System" "ApplicationType" -> "User" "ApplicationType" -> "Internal" "ApplicationType" -> "Any"
Callback function to process each page of application information. Passing a callback is required.
Callback data passed to status_cb.
member.returns: INSTPROXY_E_SUCCESS on success or an INSTPROXY_E_* error value if an error occured.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.InstallationProxy.InstallationProxyApi.instproxy_lookup(iMobileDevice.InstallationProxy.InstallationProxyClientHandle,System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection{System.String},iMobileDevice.Plist.PlistHandle,iMobileDevice.Plist.PlistHandle@)
member.summary: Lookup information about specific applications from the device.
member.param: The connected installation_proxy client
An array of bundle identifiers that MUST have a terminating NULL entry or NULL to lookup all.
The client options to use, as PLIST_DICT, or NULL. Currently there are no known client options, so pass NULL here.
Pointer that will be set to a plist containing a PLIST_DICT holding requested information about the application or NULL on errors.
member.returns: INSTPROXY_E_SUCCESS on success or an INSTPROXY_E_* error value if an error occured.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.InstallationProxy.InstallationProxyApi.instproxy_install(iMobileDevice.InstallationProxy.InstallationProxyClientHandle,System.String,iMobileDevice.Plist.PlistHandle,iMobileDevice.InstallationProxy.InstallationProxyStatusCallBack,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Install an application on the device.
member.param: The connected installation_proxy client
Path of the installation package (inside the AFC jail)

The client options to use, as PLIST_DICT, or NULL. Valid options include: "iTunesMetadata" -> PLIST_DATA "ApplicationSINF" -> PLIST_DATA "PackageType" -> "Developer" If PackageType -> Developer is specified, then pkg_path points to an .app directory instead of an install package.
Callback function for progress and status information. If NULL is passed, this function will run synchronously.
Callback data passed to status_cb.
member.returns: INSTPROXY_E_SUCCESS on success or an INSTPROXY_E_* error value if an error occured.
member.remarks: If a callback function is given (async mode), this function returns INSTPROXY_E_SUCCESS immediately if the status updater thread has been created successfully; any error occuring during the command has to be handled inside the specified callback function.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.InstallationProxy.InstallationProxyApi.instproxy_upgrade(iMobileDevice.InstallationProxy.InstallationProxyClientHandle,System.String,iMobileDevice.Plist.PlistHandle,iMobileDevice.InstallationProxy.InstallationProxyStatusCallBack,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Upgrade an application on the device. This function is nearly the same as instproxy_install; the difference is that the installation progress on the device is faster if the application is already installed.
member.param: The connected installation_proxy client
Path of the installation package (inside the AFC jail)

The client options to use, as PLIST_DICT, or NULL. Valid options include: "iTunesMetadata" -> PLIST_DATA "ApplicationSINF" -> PLIST_DATA "PackageType" -> "Developer" If PackageType -> Developer is specified, then pkg_path points to an .app directory instead of an install package.
Callback function for progress and status information. If NULL is passed, this function will run synchronously.
Callback data passed to status_cb.
member.returns: INSTPROXY_E_SUCCESS on success or an INSTPROXY_E_* error value if an error occured.
member.remarks: If a callback function is given (async mode), this function returns INSTPROXY_E_SUCCESS immediately if the status updater thread has been created successfully; any error occuring during the command has to be handled inside the specified callback function.

member.summary: Uninstall an application from the device.

ApplicationIdentifier of the app to uninstall

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.InstallationProxy.InstallationProxyApi.instproxy_archive(iMobileDevice.InstallationProxy.InstallationProxyClientHandle,System.String,iMobileDevice.Plist.PlistHandle,iMobileDevice.InstallationProxy.InstallationProxyStatusCallBack,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Archive an application on the device. This function tells the device to make an archive of the specified application. This results in the device creating a ZIP archive in the 'ApplicationArchives' directory and uninstalling the application.
member.param: The connected installation proxy client
ApplicationIdentifier of the app to archive.
The client options to use, as PLIST_DICT, or NULL. Valid options include: "SkipUninstall" -> Boolean "ArchiveType" -> "ApplicationOnly"
Callback function for progress and status information. If NULL is passed, this function will run synchronously.
Callback data passed to status_cb.
member.returns: INSTPROXY_E_SUCCESS on success or an INSTPROXY_E_* error value if an error occured.
member.remarks: If a callback function is given (async mode), this function returns INSTPROXY_E_SUCCESS immediately if the status updater thread has been created successfully; any error occuring during the command has to be handled inside the specified callback function.

member.param: The connected installation proxy client
ApplicationIdentifier of the app to restore.
The client options to use, as PLIST_DICT, or NULL. Valid options include: "ArchiveType" -> "DocumentsOnly"
Callback function for progress and status information. If NULL is passed, this function will run synchronously.
Callback data passed to status_cb.
member.returns: INSTPROXY_E_SUCCESS on success or an INSTPROXY_E_* error value if an error occured.
member.remarks: If a callback function is given (async mode), this function returns INSTPROXY_E_SUCCESS immediately if the status updater thread has been created successfully; any error occuring during the command has to be handled inside the specified callback function.

member.summary: Gets error name, code and description from a response if available.
member.param: The dictionary status response to use.
Pointer to store the name of an error.
Pointer to store error description text if available. The caller is reponsible for freeing the allocated buffer after use. If NULL is passed no description will be returned.

member.summary: Gets total and current item information from a browse response if available.
member.param: The dictionary status response to use.
Pointer to store the total number of items.
Pointer to store the current index of all browsed items.
Pointer to store the amount of items in the current list.

Pointer to store a newly allocated plist with items. The caller is reponsible for freeing the list after use. If NULL is passed no list will be returned. If NULL is returned no list was found in the status.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.Lockdown.ILockdownApi.lockdownd_client_new(iMobileDevice.iDevice.iDeviceHandle,iMobileDevice.Lockdown.LockdownClientHandle@,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new lockdownd client for the device.
member.param: The device to create a lockdownd client for
The pointer to the location of the new lockdownd_client
The label to use for communication. Usually the program name.
member.returns: LOCKDOWN_E_SUCCESS on success, LOCKDOWN_E_INVALID_ARG when client is NULL
member.remarks: This function does not pair with the device or start a session. This has to be done manually by the caller after the client is created. The device disconnects automatically if the lockdown connection idles for more than 10 seconds. Make sure to call lockdownd_client_free() as soon as the connection is no longer needed.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.Lockdown.ILockdownApi.lockdownd_client_new_with_handshake(iMobileDevice.iDevice.iDeviceHandle,iMobileDevice.Lockdown.LockdownClientHandle@,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new lockdownd client for the device and starts initial handshake. The handshake consists out of query_type, validate_pair, pair and start_session calls. It uses the internal pairing record management.
member.param: The device to create a lockdownd client for
The pointer to the location of the new lockdownd_client
The label to use for communication. Usually the program name. Pass NULL to disable sending the label in requests to lockdownd.
member.returns: LOCKDOWN_E_SUCCESS on success, LOCKDOWN_E_INVALID_ARG when client is NULL, LOCKDOWN_E_INVALID_CONF if configuration data is wrong
member.remarks: The device disconnects automatically if the lockdown connection idles for more than 10 seconds. Make sure to call lockdownd_client_free() as soon as the connection is no longer needed.

member.summary: Requests to start a service and retrieve it's port on success. Sends the escrow bag from the device's pair record.

The identifier of the service to start
The service descriptor on success or NULL on failure

The HostID of the computer
The new session_id of the created session
Whether SSL communication is used in the session

The plist to send

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.Lockdown.ILockdownApi.lockdownd_pair(iMobileDevice.Lockdown.LockdownClientHandle,iMobileDevice.Lockdown.LockdownPairRecordHandle)
member.summary: Pairs the device using the supplied pair record.
member.param: The lockdown client
The pair record to use for pairing. If NULL is passed, then the pair records from the current machine are used. New records will be generated automatically when pairing is done for the first time.
member.returns: LOCKDOWN_E_SUCCESS on success, LOCKDOWN_E_INVALID_ARG when client is NULL, LOCKDOWN_E_PLIST_ERROR if the pair_record certificates are wrong, LOCKDOWN_E_PAIRING_FAILED if the pairing failed, LOCKDOWN_E_PASSWORD_PROTECTED if the device is password protected, LOCKDOWN_E_INVALID_HOST_ID if the device does not know the caller's host id

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.Lockdown.ILockdownApi.lockdownd_pair_with_options(iMobileDevice.Lockdown.LockdownClientHandle,iMobileDevice.Lockdown.LockdownPairRecordHandle,iMobileDevice.Plist.PlistHandle,iMobileDevice.Plist.PlistHandle@)
member.summary: Pairs the device using the supplied pair record and passing the given options.
member.param: The lockdown client
The pair record to use for pairing. If NULL is passed, then the pair records from the current machine are used. New records will be generated automatically when pairing is done for the first time.
The pairing options to pass. Can be NULL for no options.
If non-NULL a pointer to lockdownd's response dictionary is returned. The caller is responsible to free the response dictionary with plist_free().
member.returns: LOCKDOWN_E_SUCCESS on success, LOCKDOWN_E_INVALID_ARG when client is NULL, LOCKDOWN_E_PLIST_ERROR if the pair_record certificates are wrong, LOCKDOWN_E_PAIRING_FAILED if the pairing failed, LOCKDOWN_E_PASSWORD_PROTECTED if the device is password protected, LOCKDOWN_E_INVALID_HOST_ID if the device does not know the caller's host id

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.Lockdown.ILockdownApi.lockdownd_validate_pair(iMobileDevice.Lockdown.LockdownClientHandle,iMobileDevice.Lockdown.LockdownPairRecordHandle)
member.summary: Validates if the device is paired with the given HostID. If successful the specified host will become trusted host of the device indicated by the lockdownd preference named TrustedHostAttached. Otherwise the host must be paired using lockdownd_pair() first.
member.param: The lockdown client
The pair record to validate pairing with. If NULL is passed, then the pair record is read from the internal pairing record management.
member.returns: LOCKDOWN_E_SUCCESS on success, LOCKDOWN_E_INVALID_ARG when client is NULL, LOCKDOWN_E_PLIST_ERROR if the pair_record certificates are wrong, LOCKDOWN_E_PAIRING_FAILED if the pairing failed, LOCKDOWN_E_PASSWORD_PROTECTED if the device is password protected, LOCKDOWN_E_INVALID_HOST_ID if the device does not know the caller's host id

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.Lockdown.ILockdownApi.lockdownd_unpair(iMobileDevice.Lockdown.LockdownClientHandle,iMobileDevice.Lockdown.LockdownPairRecordHandle)
member.summary: Unpairs the device with the given HostID and removes the pairing records from the device and host if the internal pairing record management is used.
member.param: The lockdown client
The pair record to use for unpair. If NULL is passed, then the pair records from the current machine are used.
member.returns: LOCKDOWN_E_SUCCESS on success, LOCKDOWN_E_INVALID_ARG when client is NULL, LOCKDOWN_E_PLIST_ERROR if the pair_record certificates are wrong, LOCKDOWN_E_PAIRING_FAILED if the pairing failed, LOCKDOWN_E_PASSWORD_PROTECTED if the device is password protected, LOCKDOWN_E_INVALID_HOST_ID if the device does not know the caller's host id

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.Lockdown.ILockdownApi.lockdownd_activate(iMobileDevice.Lockdown.LockdownClientHandle,iMobileDevice.Plist.PlistHandle)
member.summary: Activates the device. Only works within an open session. The ActivationRecord plist dictionary must be obtained using the activation protocol requesting from Apple's https webservice.
member.param: The lockdown client
The activation record plist dictionary
member.returns: LOCKDOWN_E_SUCCESS on success, LOCKDOWN_E_INVALID_ARG when client or activation_record is NULL, LOCKDOWN_E_NO_RUNNING_SESSION if no session is open, LOCKDOWN_E_PLIST_ERROR if the received plist is broken, LOCKDOWN_E_ACTIVATION_FAILED if the activation failed, LOCKDOWN_E_INVALID_ACTIVATION_RECORD if the device reports that the activation_record is invalid

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.Lockdown.LockdownApi.lockdownd_pair(iMobileDevice.Lockdown.LockdownClientHandle,iMobileDevice.Lockdown.LockdownPairRecordHandle)
member.summary: Pairs the device using the supplied pair record.
member.param: The lockdown client
The pair record to use for pairing. If NULL is passed, then the pair records from the current machine are used. New records will be generated automatically when pairing is done for the first time.
member.returns: LOCKDOWN_E_SUCCESS on success, LOCKDOWN_E_INVALID_ARG when client is NULL, LOCKDOWN_E_PLIST_ERROR if the pair_record certificates are wrong, LOCKDOWN_E_PAIRING_FAILED if the pairing failed, LOCKDOWN_E_PASSWORD_PROTECTED if the device is password protected, LOCKDOWN_E_INVALID_HOST_ID if the device does not know the caller's host id

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.Lockdown.LockdownApi.lockdownd_pair_with_options(iMobileDevice.Lockdown.LockdownClientHandle,iMobileDevice.Lockdown.LockdownPairRecordHandle,iMobileDevice.Plist.PlistHandle,iMobileDevice.Plist.PlistHandle@)
member.summary: Pairs the device using the supplied pair record and passing the given options.
member.param: The lockdown client
The pair record to use for pairing. If NULL is passed, then the pair records from the current machine are used. New records will be generated automatically when pairing is done for the first time.
The pairing options to pass. Can be NULL for no options.
If non-NULL a pointer to lockdownd's response dictionary is returned. The caller is responsible to free the response dictionary with plist_free().
member.returns: LOCKDOWN_E_SUCCESS on success, LOCKDOWN_E_INVALID_ARG when client is NULL, LOCKDOWN_E_PLIST_ERROR if the pair_record certificates are wrong, LOCKDOWN_E_PAIRING_FAILED if the pairing failed, LOCKDOWN_E_PASSWORD_PROTECTED if the device is password protected, LOCKDOWN_E_INVALID_HOST_ID if the device does not know the caller's host id

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.Lockdown.LockdownApi.lockdownd_validate_pair(iMobileDevice.Lockdown.LockdownClientHandle,iMobileDevice.Lockdown.LockdownPairRecordHandle)
member.summary: Validates if the device is paired with the given HostID. If successful the specified host will become trusted host of the device indicated by the lockdownd preference named TrustedHostAttached. Otherwise the host must be paired using lockdownd_pair() first.
member.param: The lockdown client
The pair record to validate pairing with. If NULL is passed, then the pair record is read from the internal pairing record management.
member.returns: LOCKDOWN_E_SUCCESS on success, LOCKDOWN_E_INVALID_ARG when client is NULL, LOCKDOWN_E_PLIST_ERROR if the pair_record certificates are wrong, LOCKDOWN_E_PAIRING_FAILED if the pairing failed, LOCKDOWN_E_PASSWORD_PROTECTED if the device is password protected, LOCKDOWN_E_INVALID_HOST_ID if the device does not know the caller's host id

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.Lockdown.LockdownApi.lockdownd_unpair(iMobileDevice.Lockdown.LockdownClientHandle,iMobileDevice.Lockdown.LockdownPairRecordHandle)
member.summary: Unpairs the device with the given HostID and removes the pairing records from the device and host if the internal pairing record management is used.
member.param: The lockdown client
The pair record to use for unpair. If NULL is passed, then the pair records from the current machine are used.
member.returns: LOCKDOWN_E_SUCCESS on success, LOCKDOWN_E_INVALID_ARG when client is NULL, LOCKDOWN_E_PLIST_ERROR if the pair_record certificates are wrong, LOCKDOWN_E_PAIRING_FAILED if the pairing failed, LOCKDOWN_E_PASSWORD_PROTECTED if the device is password protected, LOCKDOWN_E_INVALID_HOST_ID if the device does not know the caller's host id

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.Lockdown.LockdownApi.lockdownd_activate(iMobileDevice.Lockdown.LockdownClientHandle,iMobileDevice.Plist.PlistHandle)
member.summary: Activates the device. Only works within an open session. The ActivationRecord plist dictionary must be obtained using the activation protocol requesting from Apple's https webservice.
member.param: The lockdown client
The activation record plist dictionary
member.returns: LOCKDOWN_E_SUCCESS on success, LOCKDOWN_E_INVALID_ARG when client or activation_record is NULL, LOCKDOWN_E_NO_RUNNING_SESSION if no session is open, LOCKDOWN_E_PLIST_ERROR if the received plist is broken, LOCKDOWN_E_ACTIVATION_FAILED if the activation failed, LOCKDOWN_E_INVALID_ACTIVATION_RECORD if the device reports that the activation_record is invalid

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.Lockdown.LockdownNativeMethods.lockdownd_client_new(iMobileDevice.iDevice.iDeviceHandle,iMobileDevice.Lockdown.LockdownClientHandle@,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new lockdownd client for the device.
member.param: The device to create a lockdownd client for
The pointer to the location of the new lockdownd_client
The label to use for communication. Usually the program name.
member.returns: LOCKDOWN_E_SUCCESS on success, LOCKDOWN_E_INVALID_ARG when client is NULL
member.remarks: This function does not pair with the device or start a session. This has to be done manually by the caller after the client is created. The device disconnects automatically if the lockdown connection idles for more than 10 seconds. Make sure to call lockdownd_client_free() as soon as the connection is no longer needed.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.Lockdown.LockdownNativeMethods.lockdownd_client_new_with_handshake(iMobileDevice.iDevice.iDeviceHandle,iMobileDevice.Lockdown.LockdownClientHandle@,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new lockdownd client for the device and starts initial handshake. The handshake consists out of query_type, validate_pair, pair and start_session calls. It uses the internal pairing record management.
member.param: The device to create a lockdownd client for
The pointer to the location of the new lockdownd_client
The label to use for communication. Usually the program name. Pass NULL to disable sending the label in requests to lockdownd.
member.returns: LOCKDOWN_E_SUCCESS on success, LOCKDOWN_E_INVALID_ARG when client is NULL, LOCKDOWN_E_INVALID_CONF if configuration data is wrong
member.remarks: The device disconnects automatically if the lockdown connection idles for more than 10 seconds. Make sure to call lockdownd_client_free() as soon as the connection is no longer needed.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.Misagent.IMisagentApi.misagent_install(iMobileDevice.Misagent.MisagentClientHandle,iMobileDevice.Plist.PlistHandle)
member.summary: Installs the given provisioning profile. Only works with valid profiles.
member.param: The connected misagent to use for installation
The valid provisioning profile to install. This has to be passed as a PLIST_DATA, otherwise the function will fail.
member.returns: MISAGENT_E_SUCCESS on success, MISAGENT_E_INVALID_ARG when client is invalid, or an MISAGENT_E_* error code otherwise.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.Misagent.IMisagentApi.misagent_copy(iMobileDevice.Misagent.MisagentClientHandle,iMobileDevice.Plist.PlistHandle@)
member.summary: Retrieves all installed provisioning profiles (iOS 9.2.1 or below).
member.param: The connected misagent to use.
Pointer to a plist_t that will be set to a PLIST_ARRAY if the function is successful.
member.returns: MISAGENT_E_SUCCESS on success, MISAGENT_E_INVALID_ARG when client is invalid, or an MISAGENT_E_* error code otherwise.
member.remarks: This API call only works with iOS 9.2.1 or below. For newer iOS versions use misagent_copy_all() instead. If no provisioning profiles are installed on the device, this function still returns MISAGENT_E_SUCCESS and profiles will just point to an empty array.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.Misagent.IMisagentApi.misagent_copy_all(iMobileDevice.Misagent.MisagentClientHandle,iMobileDevice.Plist.PlistHandle@)

member.returns: MISAGENT_E_SUCCESS on success, MISAGENT_E_INVALID_ARG when client is invalid, or an MISAGENT_E_* error code otherwise.
member.remarks: This API call only works with iOS 9.3 or higher. For older iOS versions use misagent_copy() instead. If no provisioning profiles are installed on the device, this function still returns MISAGENT_E_SUCCESS and profiles will just point to an empty array.

member.summary: Retrieves the activation info required for device activation in 'session' mode. This function expects a handshake result retrieved from https://albert.apple.com/deviceservies/drmHandshake with a blob provided by mobileactivation_create_activation_session_info().

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.MobileBackup2.IMobileBackup2Api.mobilebackup2_client_new(iMobileDevice.iDevice.iDeviceHandle,iMobileDevice.Lockdown.LockdownServiceDescriptorHandle,iMobileDevice.MobileBackup2.MobileBackup2ClientHandle@)
member.summary: Connects to the mobilebackup2 service on the specified device.
member.param: The device to connect to.
The service descriptor returned by lockdownd_start_service.
Pointer that will be set to a newly allocated mobilebackup2_client_t upon successful return.
member.returns: MOBILEBACKUP2_E_SUCCESS on success, MOBILEBACKUP2_E_INVALID ARG if one or more parameter is invalid, or MOBILEBACKUP2_E_BAD_VERSION if the mobilebackup2 version on the device is newer.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.MobileBackup2.IMobileBackup2Api.mobilebackup2_client_start_service(iMobileDevice.iDevice.iDeviceHandle,iMobileDevice.MobileBackup2.MobileBackup2ClientHandle@,System.String)
member.summary: Starts a new mobilebackup2 service on the specified device and connects to it.
member.param: The device to connect to.
Pointer that will point to a newly allocated mobilebackup2_client_t upon successful return. Must be freed using mobilebackup2_client_free() after use.
The label to use for communication. Usually the program name. Pass NULL to disable sending the label in requests to lockdownd.
member.returns: MOBILEBACKUP2_E_SUCCESS on success, or an MOBILEBACKUP2_E_* error code otherwise.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.MobileBackup2.IMobileBackup2Api.mobilebackup2_client_free(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Disconnects a mobilebackup2 client from the device and frees up the mobilebackup2 client data.
member.param: The mobilebackup2 client to disconnect and free.
member.returns: MOBILEBACKUP2_E_SUCCESS on success, or MOBILEBACKUP2_E_INVALID_ARG if client is NULL.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.MobileBackup2.IMobileBackup2Api.mobilebackup2_send_message(iMobileDevice.MobileBackup2.MobileBackup2ClientHandle,System.String,iMobileDevice.Plist.PlistHandle)
member.summary: Sends a backup message plist.
member.param: The connected MobileBackup client to use.
The message to send. This will be inserted into the request plist as value for MessageName. If this parameter is NULL, the plist passed in the options parameter will be sent directly.

Additional options as PLIST_DICT to add to the request. The MessageName key with the value passed in the message parameter will be inserted into this plist before sending it. This parameter can be NULL if message is not NULL.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.MobileBackup2.IMobileBackup2Api.mobilebackup2_receive_message(iMobileDevice.MobileBackup2.MobileBackup2ClientHandle,iMobileDevice.Plist.PlistHandle@,System.String@)
member.summary: Receives a DL* message plist from the device. This function is a wrapper around device_link_service_receive_message.
member.param: The connected MobileBackup client to use.
Pointer to a plist that will be set to the contents of the message plist upon successful return.

A pointer that will be set to a newly allocated char* containing the DL* string from the given plist. It is up to the caller to free the allocated memory. If this parameter is NULL it will be ignored.
member.returns: MOBILEBACKUP2_E_SUCCESS if a DL* message was received, MOBILEBACKUP2_E_INVALID_ARG if client or message is invalid, MOBILEBACKUP2_E_PLIST_ERROR if the received plist is invalid or is not a DL* message plist, or MOBILEBACKUP2_E_MUX_ERROR if receiving from the device failed.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.MobileBackup2.IMobileBackup2Api.mobilebackup2_send_raw(iMobileDevice.MobileBackup2.MobileBackup2ClientHandle,System.Byte[],System.UInt32,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Send binary data to the device.
member.param: The MobileBackup client to send to.
Pointer to the data to send
Number of bytes to send
Number of bytes actually sent
member.returns: MOBILEBACKUP2_E_SUCCESS if any data was successfully sent, MOBILEBACKUP2_E_INVALID_ARG if one of the parameters is invalid, or MOBILEBACKUP2_E_MUX_ERROR if sending of the data failed.
member.remarks: This function returns MOBILEBACKUP2_E_SUCCESS even if less than the requested length has been sent. The fourth parameter is required and must be checked to ensure if the whole data has been sent.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.MobileBackup2.IMobileBackup2Api.mobilebackup2_receive_raw(iMobileDevice.MobileBackup2.MobileBackup2ClientHandle,System.Byte[],System.UInt32,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Receive binary from the device.
member.param: The MobileBackup client to receive from.
Pointer to a buffer that will be filled with the received data.
Number of bytes to receive. The data buffer needs to be large enough to store this amount of data.
Number of bytes actually received.
member.returns: MOBILEBACKUP2_E_SUCCESS if any or no data was received, MOBILEBACKUP2_E_INVALID_ARG if one of the parameters is invalid, or MOBILEBACKUP2_E_MUX_ERROR if receiving the data failed.
member.remarks: This function returns MOBILEBACKUP2_E_SUCCESS even if no data has been received (unless a communication error occured). The fourth parameter is required and must be checked to know how many bytes were actually received.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.MobileBackup2.IMobileBackup2Api.mobilebackup2_version_exchange(iMobileDevice.MobileBackup2.MobileBackup2ClientHandle,System.IntPtr,System.SByte,System.Double@)
member.summary: Performs the mobilebackup2 protocol version exchange.
member.param: The MobileBackup client to use.
An array of supported versions to send to the remote.
The number of items in local_versions.
Holds the protocol version of the remote on success.
member.returns: MOBILEBACKUP2_E_SUCCESS on success, or a MOBILEBACKUP2_E_* error code otherwise.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.MobileBackup2.IMobileBackup2Api.mobilebackup2_send_request(iMobileDevice.MobileBackup2.MobileBackup2ClientHandle,System.String,System.String,System.String,iMobileDevice.Plist.PlistHandle)
member.summary: Send a request to the connected mobilebackup2 service.
member.param: The request to send to the backup service. Currently, this is one of "Backup", "Restore", "Info", or "List".
UDID of the target device.
UDID of backup data?
Additional options in a plist of type PLIST_DICT.
member.returns: MOBILEBACKUP2_E_SUCCESS if the request was successfully sent, or a MOBILEBACKUP2_E_* error value otherwise.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.MobileBackup2.IMobileBackup2Api.mobilebackup2_send_status_response(iMobileDevice.MobileBackup2.MobileBackup2ClientHandle,System.Int32,System.String,iMobileDevice.Plist.PlistHandle)
member.summary: Sends a DLMessageStatusResponse to the device.
member.param: The MobileBackup client to use.
The status code to send.
A status message to send. Can be NULL if not required.
An additional status plist to attach to the response. Can be NULL if not required.
member.returns: MOBILEBACKUP2_E_SUCCESS on success, MOBILEBACKUP2_E_INVALID_ARG if client is invalid, or another MOBILEBACKUP2_E_* otherwise.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.MobileBackup2.MobileBackup2NativeMethods.mobilebackup2_client_new(iMobileDevice.iDevice.iDeviceHandle,iMobileDevice.Lockdown.LockdownServiceDescriptorHandle,iMobileDevice.MobileBackup2.MobileBackup2ClientHandle@)
member.summary: Connects to the mobilebackup2 service on the specified device.
member.param: The device to connect to.
The service descriptor returned by lockdownd_start_service.
Pointer that will be set to a newly allocated mobilebackup2_client_t upon successful return.
member.returns: MOBILEBACKUP2_E_SUCCESS on success, MOBILEBACKUP2_E_INVALID ARG if one or more parameter is invalid, or MOBILEBACKUP2_E_BAD_VERSION if the mobilebackup2 version on the device is newer.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.MobileBackup2.MobileBackup2NativeMethods.mobilebackup2_client_start_service(iMobileDevice.iDevice.iDeviceHandle,iMobileDevice.MobileBackup2.MobileBackup2ClientHandle@,System.String)
member.summary: Starts a new mobilebackup2 service on the specified device and connects to it.
member.param: The device to connect to.
Pointer that will point to a newly allocated mobilebackup2_client_t upon successful return. Must be freed using mobilebackup2_client_free() after use.
The label to use for communication. Usually the program name. Pass NULL to disable sending the label in requests to lockdownd.
member.returns: MOBILEBACKUP2_E_SUCCESS on success, or an MOBILEBACKUP2_E_* error code otherwise.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.MobileBackup2.MobileBackup2NativeMethods.mobilebackup2_client_free(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Disconnects a mobilebackup2 client from the device and frees up the mobilebackup2 client data.
member.param: The mobilebackup2 client to disconnect and free.
member.returns: MOBILEBACKUP2_E_SUCCESS on success, or MOBILEBACKUP2_E_INVALID_ARG if client is NULL.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.MobileBackup2.MobileBackup2NativeMethods.mobilebackup2_send_message(iMobileDevice.MobileBackup2.MobileBackup2ClientHandle,System.String,iMobileDevice.Plist.PlistHandle)
member.summary: Sends a backup message plist.
member.param: The connected MobileBackup client to use.
The message to send. This will be inserted into the request plist as value for MessageName. If this parameter is NULL, the plist passed in the options parameter will be sent directly.

Additional options as PLIST_DICT to add to the request. The MessageName key with the value passed in the message parameter will be inserted into this plist before sending it. This parameter can be NULL if message is not NULL.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.MobileBackup2.MobileBackup2NativeMethods.mobilebackup2_receive_message(iMobileDevice.MobileBackup2.MobileBackup2ClientHandle,iMobileDevice.Plist.PlistHandle@,System.IntPtr@)
member.summary: Receives a DL* message plist from the device. This function is a wrapper around device_link_service_receive_message.
member.param: The connected MobileBackup client to use.
Pointer to a plist that will be set to the contents of the message plist upon successful return.

A pointer that will be set to a newly allocated char* containing the DL* string from the given plist. It is up to the caller to free the allocated memory. If this parameter is NULL it will be ignored.
member.returns: MOBILEBACKUP2_E_SUCCESS if a DL* message was received, MOBILEBACKUP2_E_INVALID_ARG if client or message is invalid, MOBILEBACKUP2_E_PLIST_ERROR if the received plist is invalid or is not a DL* message plist, or MOBILEBACKUP2_E_MUX_ERROR if receiving from the device failed.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.MobileBackup2.MobileBackup2NativeMethods.mobilebackup2_send_raw(iMobileDevice.MobileBackup2.MobileBackup2ClientHandle,System.Byte[],System.UInt32,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Send binary data to the device.
member.param: The MobileBackup client to send to.
Pointer to the data to send
Number of bytes to send
Number of bytes actually sent
member.returns: MOBILEBACKUP2_E_SUCCESS if any data was successfully sent, MOBILEBACKUP2_E_INVALID_ARG if one of the parameters is invalid, or MOBILEBACKUP2_E_MUX_ERROR if sending of the data failed.
member.remarks: This function returns MOBILEBACKUP2_E_SUCCESS even if less than the requested length has been sent. The fourth parameter is required and must be checked to ensure if the whole data has been sent.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.MobileBackup2.MobileBackup2NativeMethods.mobilebackup2_receive_raw(iMobileDevice.MobileBackup2.MobileBackup2ClientHandle,System.Byte[],System.UInt32,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Receive binary from the device.
member.param: The MobileBackup client to receive from.
Pointer to a buffer that will be filled with the received data.
Number of bytes to receive. The data buffer needs to be large enough to store this amount of data.
Number of bytes actually received.
member.returns: MOBILEBACKUP2_E_SUCCESS if any or no data was received, MOBILEBACKUP2_E_INVALID_ARG if one of the parameters is invalid, or MOBILEBACKUP2_E_MUX_ERROR if receiving the data failed.
member.remarks: This function returns MOBILEBACKUP2_E_SUCCESS even if no data has been received (unless a communication error occured). The fourth parameter is required and must be checked to know how many bytes were actually received.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.MobileBackup2.MobileBackup2NativeMethods.mobilebackup2_version_exchange(iMobileDevice.MobileBackup2.MobileBackup2ClientHandle,System.IntPtr,System.SByte,System.Double@)
member.summary: Performs the mobilebackup2 protocol version exchange.
member.param: The MobileBackup client to use.
An array of supported versions to send to the remote.
The number of items in local_versions.
Holds the protocol version of the remote on success.
member.returns: MOBILEBACKUP2_E_SUCCESS on success, or a MOBILEBACKUP2_E_* error code otherwise.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.MobileBackup2.MobileBackup2NativeMethods.mobilebackup2_send_request(iMobileDevice.MobileBackup2.MobileBackup2ClientHandle,System.String,System.String,System.String,iMobileDevice.Plist.PlistHandle)
member.summary: Send a request to the connected mobilebackup2 service.
member.param: The request to send to the backup service. Currently, this is one of "Backup", "Restore", "Info", or "List".
UDID of the target device.
UDID of backup data?
Additional options in a plist of type PLIST_DICT.
member.returns: MOBILEBACKUP2_E_SUCCESS if the request was successfully sent, or a MOBILEBACKUP2_E_* error value otherwise.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.MobileBackup2.MobileBackup2NativeMethods.mobilebackup2_send_status_response(iMobileDevice.MobileBackup2.MobileBackup2ClientHandle,System.Int32,System.String,iMobileDevice.Plist.PlistHandle)
member.summary: Sends a DLMessageStatusResponse to the device.
member.param: The MobileBackup client to use.
The status code to send.
A status message to send. Can be NULL if not required.
An additional status plist to attach to the response. Can be NULL if not required.
member.returns: MOBILEBACKUP2_E_SUCCESS on success, MOBILEBACKUP2_E_INVALID_ARG if client is invalid, or another MOBILEBACKUP2_E_* otherwise.

The location of the plist to send
