member.name: M:iMobileDevice.MobileBackup.IMobileBackupApi.mobilebackup_request_backup(iMobileDevice.MobileBackup.MobileBackupClientHandle,iMobileDevice.Plist.PlistHandle,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Request a backup from the connected device.
member.param: The connected MobileBackup client to use.
The backup manifest, a plist_t of type PLIST_DICT containing the backup state of the last backup. For a first-time backup set this parameter to NULL.
The base path on the device to use for the backup operation, usually "/".
A string denoting the version of the backup protocol to use. Latest known version is "1.6"
member.returns: MOBILEBACKUP_E_SUCCESS on success, MOBILEBACKUP_E_INVALID_ARG if one of the parameters is invalid, MOBILEBACKUP_E_PLIST_ERROR if backup_manifest is not of type PLIST_DICT, MOBILEBACKUP_E_MUX_ERROR if a communication error occurs, MOBILEBACKUP_E_REPLY_NOT_OK

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.MobileBackup.IMobileBackupApi.mobilebackup_send_backup_file_received(iMobileDevice.MobileBackup.MobileBackupClientHandle)
member.summary: Sends a confirmation to the device that a backup file has been received.
member.param: The connected MobileBackup client to use.
member.returns: MOBILEBACKUP_E_SUCCESS on success, MOBILEBACKUP_E_INVALID_ARG if client is invalid, or MOBILEBACKUP_E_MUX_ERROR if a communication error occurs.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.MobileBackup.IMobileBackupApi.mobilebackup_request_restore(iMobileDevice.MobileBackup.MobileBackupClientHandle,iMobileDevice.Plist.PlistHandle,iMobileDevice.MobileBackup.MobileBackupFlags,System.String)
member.summary: Request that a backup should be restored to the connected device.
member.param: The connected MobileBackup client to use.
The backup manifest, a plist_t of type PLIST_DICT containing the backup state to be restored.

Flags to send with the request. Currently this is a combination of the following mobilebackup_flags_t: MB_RESTORE_NOTIFY_SPRINGBOARD - let SpringBoard show a 'Restore' screen MB_RESTORE_PRESERVE_SETTINGS - do not overwrite any settings MB_RESTORE_PRESERVE_CAMERA_ROLL - preserve the photos of the camera roll
A string denoting the version of the backup protocol to use. Latest known version is "1.6". Ideally this value should be extracted from the given manifest plist.
member.returns: MOBILEBACKUP_E_SUCCESS on success, MOBILEBACKUP_E_INVALID_ARG if one of the parameters is invalid, MOBILEBACKUP_E_PLIST_ERROR if backup_manifest is not of type PLIST_DICT, MOBILEBACKUP_E_MUX_ERROR if a communication error occurs, or MOBILEBACKUP_E_REPLY_NOT_OK if the device did not accept the request.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.MobileBackup.IMobileBackupApi.mobilebackup_receive_restore_file_received(iMobileDevice.MobileBackup.MobileBackupClientHandle,iMobileDevice.Plist.PlistHandle@)
member.summary: Receive a confirmation from the device that it successfully received a restore file.
member.param: The connected MobileBackup client to use.

Pointer to a plist_t that will be set to the received plist for further processing. The caller has to free it using plist_free(). Note that it will be set to NULL if the operation itself fails due to a communication or plist error. If this parameter is NULL, it will be ignored.
member.returns: MOBILEBACKUP_E_SUCCESS on success, MOBILEBACKUP_E_INVALID_ARG if client is invalid, MOBILEBACKUP_E_REPLY_NOT_OK if the expected 'BackupMessageRestoreFileReceived' message could not be received, MOBILEBACKUP_E_PLIST_ERROR if the received message is not a valid backup message plist, or MOBILEBACKUP_E_MUX_ERROR if a communication error occurs.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.MobileBackup.IMobileBackupApi.mobilebackup_receive_restore_application_received(iMobileDevice.MobileBackup.MobileBackupClientHandle,iMobileDevice.Plist.PlistHandle@)
member.summary: Receive a confirmation from the device that it successfully received application data file.
member.param: The connected MobileBackup client to use.

Pointer to a plist_t that will be set to the received plist for further processing. The caller has to free it using plist_free(). Note that it will be set to NULL if the operation itself fails due to a communication or plist error. If this parameter is NULL, it will be ignored.
member.returns: MOBILEBACKUP_E_SUCCESS on success, MOBILEBACKUP_E_INVALID_ARG if client is invalid, MOBILEBACKUP_E_REPLY_NOT_OK if the expected 'BackupMessageRestoreApplicationReceived' message could not be received, MOBILEBACKUP_E_PLIST_ERROR if the received message is not a valid backup message plist, or MOBILEBACKUP_E_MUX_ERROR if a communication error occurs.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.MobileBackup.IMobileBackupApi.mobilebackup_send_restore_complete(iMobileDevice.MobileBackup.MobileBackupClientHandle)
member.summary: Tells the device that the restore process is complete and waits for the device to close the connection. After that, the device should reboot.
member.param: The connected MobileBackup client to use.
member.returns: MOBILEBACKUP_E_SUCCESS on success, MOBILEBACKUP_E_INVALID_ARG if client is invalid, MOBILEBACKUP_E_PLIST_ERROR if the received disconnect message plist is invalid, or MOBILEBACKUP_E_MUX_ERROR if a communication error occurs.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.MobileBackup.IMobileBackupApi.mobilebackup_send_error(iMobileDevice.MobileBackup.MobileBackupClientHandle,System.String)
member.summary: Sends a backup error message to the device.
member.param: The connected MobileBackup client to use.
A string describing the reason for the error message.
member.returns: MOBILEBACKUP_E_SUCCESS on success, MOBILEBACKUP_E_INVALID_ARG if one of the parameters is invalid, or MOBILEBACKUP_E_MUX_ERROR if a communication error occurs.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.MobileBackup.MobileBackupNativeMethods.mobilebackup_client_new(iMobileDevice.iDevice.iDeviceHandle,iMobileDevice.Lockdown.LockdownServiceDescriptorHandle,iMobileDevice.MobileBackup.MobileBackupClientHandle@)
member.summary: Connects to the mobilebackup service on the specified device.
member.param: The device to connect to.
The service descriptor returned by lockdownd_start_service.
Pointer that will be set to a newly allocated mobilebackup_client_t upon successful return.
member.returns: MOBILEBACKUP_E_SUCCESS on success, MOBILEBACKUP_E_INVALID ARG if one or more parameters are invalid, or DEVICE_LINK_SERVICE_E_BAD_VERSION if the mobilebackup version on the device is newer.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.MobileBackup.MobileBackupNativeMethods.mobilebackup_client_start_service(iMobileDevice.iDevice.iDeviceHandle,iMobileDevice.MobileBackup.MobileBackupClientHandle@,System.String)
member.summary: Starts a new mobilebackup service on the specified device and connects to it.
member.param: The device to connect to.
Pointer that will point to a newly allocated mobilebackup_client_t upon successful return. Must be freed using mobilebackup_client_free() after use.
The label to use for communication. Usually the program name. Pass NULL to disable sending the label in requests to lockdownd.
member.returns: MOBILEBACKUP_E_SUCCESS on success, or an MOBILEBACKUP_E_* error code otherwise.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.MobileBackup.MobileBackupNativeMethods.mobilebackup_client_free(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Disconnects a mobilebackup client from the device and frees up the mobilebackup client data.
member.param: The mobilebackup client to disconnect and free.
member.returns: MOBILEBACKUP_E_SUCCESS on success, or MOBILEBACKUP_E_INVALID_ARG if client is NULL.

member.summary: Polls the device for mobilebackup data.
member.param: The mobilebackup client
A pointer to the location where the plist should be stored
member.returns: an error code

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.MobileBackup.MobileBackupNativeMethods.mobilebackup_send(iMobileDevice.MobileBackup.MobileBackupClientHandle,iMobileDevice.Plist.PlistHandle)
member.summary: Sends mobilebackup data to the device
member.param: The mobilebackup client
The location of the plist to send
member.returns: an error code
member.remarks: This function is low-level and should only be used if you need to send a new type of message.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.MobileBackup.MobileBackupNativeMethods.mobilebackup_request_backup(iMobileDevice.MobileBackup.MobileBackupClientHandle,iMobileDevice.Plist.PlistHandle,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Request a backup from the connected device.
member.param: The connected MobileBackup client to use.
The backup manifest, a plist_t of type PLIST_DICT containing the backup state of the last backup. For a first-time backup set this parameter to NULL.
The base path on the device to use for the backup operation, usually "/".
A string denoting the version of the backup protocol to use. Latest known version is "1.6"
member.returns: MOBILEBACKUP_E_SUCCESS on success, MOBILEBACKUP_E_INVALID_ARG if one of the parameters is invalid, MOBILEBACKUP_E_PLIST_ERROR if backup_manifest is not of type PLIST_DICT, MOBILEBACKUP_E_MUX_ERROR if a communication error occurs, MOBILEBACKUP_E_REPLY_NOT_OK

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.MobileBackup.MobileBackupNativeMethods.mobilebackup_send_backup_file_received(iMobileDevice.MobileBackup.MobileBackupClientHandle)
member.summary: Sends a confirmation to the device that a backup file has been received.
member.param: The connected MobileBackup client to use.
member.returns: MOBILEBACKUP_E_SUCCESS on success, MOBILEBACKUP_E_INVALID_ARG if client is invalid, or MOBILEBACKUP_E_MUX_ERROR if a communication error occurs.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.MobileBackup.MobileBackupNativeMethods.mobilebackup_request_restore(iMobileDevice.MobileBackup.MobileBackupClientHandle,iMobileDevice.Plist.PlistHandle,iMobileDevice.MobileBackup.MobileBackupFlags,System.String)
member.summary: Request that a backup should be restored to the connected device.
member.param: The connected MobileBackup client to use.
The backup manifest, a plist_t of type PLIST_DICT containing the backup state to be restored.

Flags to send with the request. Currently this is a combination of the following mobilebackup_flags_t: MB_RESTORE_NOTIFY_SPRINGBOARD - let SpringBoard show a 'Restore' screen MB_RESTORE_PRESERVE_SETTINGS - do not overwrite any settings MB_RESTORE_PRESERVE_CAMERA_ROLL - preserve the photos of the camera roll
A string denoting the version of the backup protocol to use. Latest known version is "1.6". Ideally this value should be extracted from the given manifest plist.
member.returns: MOBILEBACKUP_E_SUCCESS on success, MOBILEBACKUP_E_INVALID_ARG if one of the parameters is invalid, MOBILEBACKUP_E_PLIST_ERROR if backup_manifest is not of type PLIST_DICT, MOBILEBACKUP_E_MUX_ERROR if a communication error occurs, or MOBILEBACKUP_E_REPLY_NOT_OK if the device did not accept the request.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.MobileBackup.MobileBackupNativeMethods.mobilebackup_receive_restore_file_received(iMobileDevice.MobileBackup.MobileBackupClientHandle,iMobileDevice.Plist.PlistHandle@)
member.summary: Receive a confirmation from the device that it successfully received a restore file.
member.param: The connected MobileBackup client to use.

Pointer to a plist_t that will be set to the received plist for further processing. The caller has to free it using plist_free(). Note that it will be set to NULL if the operation itself fails due to a communication or plist error. If this parameter is NULL, it will be ignored.
member.returns: MOBILEBACKUP_E_SUCCESS on success, MOBILEBACKUP_E_INVALID_ARG if client is invalid, MOBILEBACKUP_E_REPLY_NOT_OK if the expected 'BackupMessageRestoreFileReceived' message could not be received, MOBILEBACKUP_E_PLIST_ERROR if the received message is not a valid backup message plist, or MOBILEBACKUP_E_MUX_ERROR if a communication error occurs.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.MobileBackup.MobileBackupNativeMethods.mobilebackup_receive_restore_application_received(iMobileDevice.MobileBackup.MobileBackupClientHandle,iMobileDevice.Plist.PlistHandle@)
member.summary: Receive a confirmation from the device that it successfully received application data file.
member.param: The connected MobileBackup client to use.

Pointer to a plist_t that will be set to the received plist for further processing. The caller has to free it using plist_free(). Note that it will be set to NULL if the operation itself fails due to a communication or plist error. If this parameter is NULL, it will be ignored.
member.returns: MOBILEBACKUP_E_SUCCESS on success, MOBILEBACKUP_E_INVALID_ARG if client is invalid, MOBILEBACKUP_E_REPLY_NOT_OK if the expected 'BackupMessageRestoreApplicationReceived' message could not be received, MOBILEBACKUP_E_PLIST_ERROR if the received message is not a valid backup message plist, or MOBILEBACKUP_E_MUX_ERROR if a communication error occurs.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.MobileBackup.MobileBackupNativeMethods.mobilebackup_send_restore_complete(iMobileDevice.MobileBackup.MobileBackupClientHandle)
member.summary: Tells the device that the restore process is complete and waits for the device to close the connection. After that, the device should reboot.
member.param: The connected MobileBackup client to use.
member.returns: MOBILEBACKUP_E_SUCCESS on success, MOBILEBACKUP_E_INVALID_ARG if client is invalid, MOBILEBACKUP_E_PLIST_ERROR if the received disconnect message plist is invalid, or MOBILEBACKUP_E_MUX_ERROR if a communication error occurs.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.MobileBackup.MobileBackupNativeMethods.mobilebackup_send_error(iMobileDevice.MobileBackup.MobileBackupClientHandle,System.String)
member.summary: Sends a backup error message to the device.
member.param: The connected MobileBackup client to use.
A string describing the reason for the error message.
member.returns: MOBILEBACKUP_E_SUCCESS on success, MOBILEBACKUP_E_INVALID_ARG if one of the parameters is invalid, or MOBILEBACKUP_E_MUX_ERROR if a communication error occurs.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.MobileImageMounter.IMobileImageMounterApi.mobile_image_mounter_lookup_image(iMobileDevice.MobileImageMounter.MobileImageMounterClientHandle,System.String,iMobileDevice.Plist.PlistHandle@)
member.summary: Tells if the image of ImageType is already mounted.
member.param: The client use
The type of the image to look up
Pointer to a plist that will receive the result of the operation.
member.returns: MOBILE_IMAGE_MOUNTER_E_SUCCESS on success, or an error code on error
member.remarks: This function may return MOBILE_IMAGE_MOUNTER_E_SUCCESS even if the operation has failed. Check the resulting plist for further information.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.MobileImageMounter.IMobileImageMounterApi.mobile_image_mounter_upload_image(iMobileDevice.MobileImageMounter.MobileImageMounterClientHandle,System.String,System.UInt32,System.Byte[],System.UInt16,iMobileDevice.MobileImageMounter.MobileImageMounterUploadCallBack,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Uploads an image with an optional signature to the device.
member.param: The connected mobile_image_mounter client.
Type of image that is being uploaded.
Total size of the image.
Buffer with a signature of the image being uploaded. If NULL, no signature will be used.
Total size of the image signature buffer. If 0, no signature will be used.
Callback function that gets the data chunks for uploading the image.
User defined data for the upload callback function.
member.returns: MOBILE_IMAGE_MOUNTER_E_SUCCESS on succes, or a MOBILE_IMAGE_MOUNTER_E_* error code otherwise.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.MobileImageMounter.IMobileImageMounterApi.mobile_image_mounter_mount_image(iMobileDevice.MobileImageMounter.MobileImageMounterClientHandle,System.String,System.Byte[],System.UInt16,System.String,iMobileDevice.Plist.PlistHandle@)
member.summary: Mounts an image on the device.
member.param: The connected mobile_image_mounter client.
The absolute path of the image to mount. The image must be present before calling this function.
Pointer to a buffer holding the images' signature
Length of the signature image_signature points to
Type of image to mount
Pointer to a plist that will receive the result of the operation.
member.returns: MOBILE_IMAGE_MOUNTER_E_SUCCESS on success, MOBILE_IMAGE_MOUNTER_E_INVALID_ARG if on ore more parameters are invalid, or another error code otherwise.
member.remarks: This function may return MOBILE_IMAGE_MOUNTER_E_SUCCESS even if the operation has failed. Check the resulting plist for further information. Note that there is no unmounting function. The mount persists until the device is rebooted.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.MobileImageMounter.IMobileImageMounterApi.mobile_image_mounter_hangup(iMobileDevice.MobileImageMounter.MobileImageMounterClientHandle)
member.summary: Hangs up the connection to the mobile_image_mounter service. This functions has to be called before freeing up a mobile_image_mounter instance. If not, errors appear in the device's syslog.
member.param: The client to hang up
member.returns: MOBILE_IMAGE_MOUNTER_E_SUCCESS on success, MOBILE_IMAGE_MOUNTER_E_INVALID_ARG if client is invalid, or another error code otherwise.

The absolute path of the image to mount. The image must be present before calling this function.
Pointer to a buffer holding the images' signature
Length of the signature image_signature points to
Type of image to mount
Pointer to a plist that will receive the result of the operation.
member.returns: MOBILE_IMAGE_MOUNTER_E_SUCCESS on success, MOBILE_IMAGE_MOUNTER_E_INVALID_ARG if on ore more parameters are invalid, or another error code otherwise.
member.remarks: This function may return MOBILE_IMAGE_MOUNTER_E_SUCCESS even if the operation has failed. Check the resulting plist for further information. Note that there is no unmounting function. The mount persists until the device is rebooted.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.MobileImageMounter.MobileImageMounterNativeMethods.mobile_image_mounter_hangup(iMobileDevice.MobileImageMounter.MobileImageMounterClientHandle)
member.summary: Hangs up the connection to the mobile_image_mounter service. This functions has to be called before freeing up a mobile_image_mounter instance. If not, errors appear in the device's syslog.
member.param: The client to hang up
member.returns: MOBILE_IMAGE_MOUNTER_E_SUCCESS on success, MOBILE_IMAGE_MOUNTER_E_INVALID_ARG if client is invalid, or another error code otherwise.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.MobileSync.IMobileSyncApi.mobilesync_client_new(iMobileDevice.iDevice.iDeviceHandle,iMobileDevice.Lockdown.LockdownServiceDescriptorHandle,iMobileDevice.MobileSync.MobileSyncClientHandle@)
member.summary: Connects to the mobilesync service on the specified device. MOBILESYNC_E_SUCCESS on success MOBILESYNC_E_INVALID_ARG if one or more parameters are invalid DEVICE_LINK_SERVICE_E_BAD_VERSION if the mobilesync version on the device is newer.
member.param: The device to connect to.
The service descriptor returned by lockdownd_start_service.
Pointer that will be set to a newly allocated #mobilesync_client_t upon successful return.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.MobileSync.IMobileSyncApi.mobilesync_client_start_service(iMobileDevice.iDevice.iDeviceHandle,iMobileDevice.MobileSync.MobileSyncClientHandle@,System.String)
member.summary: Starts a new mobilesync service on the specified device and connects to it.
member.param: The device to connect to.
Pointer that will point to a newly allocated mobilesync_client_t upon successful return. Must be freed using mobilesync_client_free() after use.
The label to use for communication. Usually the program name. Pass NULL to disable sending the label in requests to lockdownd.
member.returns: MOBILESYNC_E_SUCCESS on success, or an MOBILESYNC_E_* error code otherwise.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.MobileSync.IMobileSyncApi.mobilesync_client_free(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Disconnects a mobilesync client from the device and frees up the mobilesync client data. MOBILESYNC_E_SUCCESS on success MOBILESYNC_E_INVALID_ARG if is NULL.
member.param: The mobilesync client to disconnect and free.

member.summary: Polls the device for mobilesync data.

A pointer to the location where the plist should be stored
member.returns: an error code

The location of the plist to send

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.MobileSync.IMobileSyncApi.mobilesync_start(iMobileDevice.MobileSync.MobileSyncClientHandle,System.Byte[],iMobileDevice.MobileSync.MobileSyncAnchorsHandle,System.UInt64,iMobileDevice.MobileSync.MobileSyncSyncType@,System.UInt64@,System.String@)
member.summary: Requests starting synchronization of a data class with the device MOBILESYNC_E_SUCCESS on success MOBILESYNC_E_INVALID_ARG if one of the parameters is invalid MOBILESYNC_E_PLIST_ERROR if the received plist is not of valid form MOBILESYNC_E_SYNC_REFUSED if the device refused to sync MOBILESYNC_E_CANCELLED if the device explicitly cancelled the sync request
member.param: The mobilesync client
The data class identifier to sync

The anchors required to exchange with the device. The anchors allow the device to tell if the synchronization information on the computer and device are consistent to determine what sync type is required.
The version of the data class storage on the computer
A pointer to store the sync type reported by the device_anchor
The version of the data class storage on the device
A pointer to store an error message if reported by the device

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.MobileSync.IMobileSyncApi.mobilesync_cancel(iMobileDevice.MobileSync.MobileSyncClientHandle,System.String)
member.summary: Cancels a running synchronization session with a device at any time. MOBILESYNC_E_SUCCESS on success MOBILESYNC_E_INVALID_ARG if one of the parameters is invalid
member.param: The mobilesync client
The reason to supply to the device for cancelling

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.MobileSync.IMobileSyncApi.mobilesync_finish(iMobileDevice.MobileSync.MobileSyncClientHandle)
member.summary: Finish a synchronization session of a data class on the device. A session must have previously been started using mobilesync_start(). MOBILESYNC_E_SUCCESS on success MOBILESYNC_E_INVALID_ARG if one of the parameters is invalid MOBILESYNC_E_PLIST_ERROR if the received plist is not of valid form
member.param: The mobilesync client

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.MobileSync.IMobileSyncApi.mobilesync_get_all_records_from_device(iMobileDevice.MobileSync.MobileSyncClientHandle)
member.summary: Requests to receive all records of the currently set data class from the device. The actually changes are retrieved using mobilesync_receive_changes() after this request has been successful. MOBILESYNC_E_SUCCESS on success MOBILESYNC_E_INVALID_ARG if one of the parameters is invalid
member.param: The mobilesync client

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.MobileSync.IMobileSyncApi.mobilesync_get_changes_from_device(iMobileDevice.MobileSync.MobileSyncClientHandle)
member.summary: Requests to receive only changed records of the currently set data class from the device. The actually changes are retrieved using mobilesync_receive_changes() after this request has been successful. MOBILESYNC_E_SUCCESS on success MOBILESYNC_E_INVALID_ARG if one of the parameters is invalid
member.param: The mobilesync client

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.MobileSync.IMobileSyncApi.mobilesync_clear_all_records_on_device(iMobileDevice.MobileSync.MobileSyncClientHandle)
member.summary: Requests the device to delete all records of the current data class MOBILESYNC_E_SUCCESS on success MOBILESYNC_E_INVALID_ARG if one of the parameters is invalid MOBILESYNC_E_PLIST_ERROR if the received plist is not of valid form
member.param: The mobilesync client
member.remarks: The operation must be called after starting synchronization.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.MobileSync.IMobileSyncApi.mobilesync_receive_changes(iMobileDevice.MobileSync.MobileSyncClientHandle,iMobileDevice.Plist.PlistHandle@,System.Char@,iMobileDevice.Plist.PlistHandle@)
member.summary: Receives changed entitites of the currently set data class from the device MOBILESYNC_E_SUCCESS on success MOBILESYNC_E_INVALID_ARG if one of the parameters is invalid MOBILESYNC_E_CANCELLED if the device explicitly cancelled the session
member.param: The mobilesync client
A pointer to store the changed entity records as a PLIST_DICT
A pointer to store a flag indicating if this submission is the last one
A pointer to additional flags the device is sending or NULL to ignore

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.MobileSync.IMobileSyncApi.mobilesync_acknowledge_changes_from_device(iMobileDevice.MobileSync.MobileSyncClientHandle)
member.summary: Acknowledges to the device that the changes have been merged on the computer MOBILESYNC_E_SUCCESS on success MOBILESYNC_E_INVALID_ARG if one of the parameters is invalid
member.param: The mobilesync client

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.MobileSync.IMobileSyncApi.mobilesync_ready_to_send_changes_from_computer(iMobileDevice.MobileSync.MobileSyncClientHandle)
member.summary: Verifies if the device is ready to receive changes from the computer. This call changes the synchronization direction so that mobilesync_send_changes() can be used to send changes to the device. MOBILESYNC_E_SUCCESS on success MOBILESYNC_E_INVALID_ARG if one of the parameters is invalid MOBILESYNC_E_PLIST_ERROR if the received plist is not of valid form MOBILESYNC_E_WRONG_DIRECTION if the current sync direction does not permit this call MOBILESYNC_E_CANCELLED if the device explicitly cancelled the session MOBILESYNC_E_NOT_READY if the device is not ready to start receiving any changes
member.param: The mobilesync client

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.MobileSync.IMobileSyncApi.mobilesync_send_changes(iMobileDevice.MobileSync.MobileSyncClientHandle,iMobileDevice.Plist.PlistHandle,System.Char,iMobileDevice.Plist.PlistHandle)
member.summary: Sends changed entities of the currently set data class to the device MOBILESYNC_E_SUCCESS on success MOBILESYNC_E_INVALID_ARG if one of the parameters is invalid, MOBILESYNC_E_WRONG_DIRECTION if the current sync direction does not permit this call
member.param: The mobilesync client
The changed entity records as a PLIST_DICT
A flag indicating if this submission is the last one
Additional actions for the device created with mobilesync_actions_new() or NULL if no actions should be passed

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.MobileSync.IMobileSyncApi.mobilesync_remap_identifiers(iMobileDevice.MobileSync.MobileSyncClientHandle,iMobileDevice.Plist.PlistHandle@)
member.summary: Receives any remapped identifiers reported after the device merged submitted changes. MOBILESYNC_E_SUCCESS on success MOBILESYNC_E_INVALID_ARG if one of the parameters is invalid MOBILESYNC_E_PLIST_ERROR if the received plist is not of valid form MOBILESYNC_E_WRONG_DIRECTION if the current sync direction does not permit this call MOBILESYNC_E_CANCELLED if the device explicitly cancelled the session
member.param: The mobilesync client
A pointer to an array plist containing a dict of identifier remappings

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.MobileSync.IMobileSyncApi.mobilesync_anchors_new(System.String,System.String,iMobileDevice.MobileSync.MobileSyncAnchorsHandle@)
member.summary: Allocates memory for a new anchors struct initialized with the passed anchors. MOBILESYNC_E_SUCCESS on success
member.param: An anchor the device reported the last time or NULL if none is known yet which for instance is true on first synchronization.
An arbitrary string to use as anchor for the computer.
Pointer that will be set to a newly allocated #mobilesync_anchors_t struct. Must be freed using mobilesync_anchors_free().

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.MobileSync.IMobileSyncApi.mobilesync_anchors_free(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Free memory used by anchors. MOBILESYNC_E_SUCCESS on success
member.param: The anchors to free.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.MobileSync.IMobileSyncApi.mobilesync_actions_new
member.summary: Create a new actions plist to use in mobilesync_send_changes().
member.returns: A new plist_t of type PLIST_DICT.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.MobileSync.IMobileSyncApi.mobilesync_actions_add(iMobileDevice.Plist.PlistHandle)
member.summary: Add one or more new key:value pairs to the given actions plist.
member.param: The actions to modify.
KEY, VALUE, [KEY, VALUE], NULL
member.remarks: The known keys so far are "SyncDeviceLinkEntityNamesKey" which expects an array of entity names, followed by a count paramter as well as "SyncDeviceLinkAllRecordsOfPulledEntityTypeSentKey" which expects an integer to use as a boolean value indicating that the device should link submitted changes and report remapped identifiers.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.MobileSync.IMobileSyncApi.mobilesync_actions_free(iMobileDevice.Plist.PlistHandle)
member.summary: Free actions plist.
member.param: The actions plist to free. Does nothing if NULL is passed.

member.summary: Requests starting synchronization of a data class with the device MOBILESYNC_E_SUCCESS on success MOBILESYNC_E_INVALID_ARG if one of the parameters is invalid MOBILESYNC_E_PLIST_ERROR if the received plist is not of valid form MOBILESYNC_E_SYNC_REFUSED if the device refused to sync MOBILESYNC_E_CANCELLED if the device explicitly cancelled the sync request
member.param: The mobilesync client
The data class identifier to sync

The anchors required to exchange with the device. The anchors allow the device to tell if the synchronization information on the computer and device are consistent to determine what sync type is required.
The version of the data class storage on the computer
A pointer to store the sync type reported by the device_anchor
The version of the data class storage on the device
A pointer to store an error message if reported by the device

member.summary: Verifies if the device is ready to receive changes from the computer. This call changes the synchronization direction so that mobilesync_send_changes() can be used to send changes to the device. MOBILESYNC_E_SUCCESS on success MOBILESYNC_E_INVALID_ARG if one of the parameters is invalid MOBILESYNC_E_PLIST_ERROR if the received plist is not of valid form MOBILESYNC_E_WRONG_DIRECTION if the current sync direction does not permit this call MOBILESYNC_E_CANCELLED if the device explicitly cancelled the session MOBILESYNC_E_NOT_READY if the device is not ready to start receiving any changes
member.param: The mobilesync client

member.param: The mobilesync client
The changed entity records as a PLIST_DICT
A flag indicating if this submission is the last one

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.NativeMethods.LoadLibrary(System.String)
member.summary: Loads the specified module into the address space of the calling process. The specified module may cause other modules to be loaded.

param.name: dllToLoad
param.para: The name of the module. This can be either a library module (a .dll file) or an executable module (an .exe file). The name specified is the file name of the module and is not related to the name stored in the library module itself, as specified by the LIBRARY keyword in the module-definition (.def) file.
If the string specifies a full path, the function searches only that path for the module.
If the string specifies a relative path or a module name without a path, the function uses a standard search strategy to find the module; for more information, see the Remarks.

If the function cannot find the module, the function fails. When specifying a path, be sure to use backslashes (\), not forward slashes (/). For more information about paths, see Naming a File or Directory.

If the string specifies a module name without a path and the file name extension is omitted, the function appends the default library extension .dll to the module name. To prevent the function from appending .dll to the module name, include a trailing point character (.) in the module name string.

member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is a handle to the module. If the function fails, the return value is . To get extended error information, call .

member.summary: The function loads the dynamic library file named by the null-terminated string filename.
member.param: The path to the file to open.
A value of the enumeration specifying how the dynamic library file is openend.
member.returns: Returns an opaque "handle" for the dynamic library.
member.remarks: This method works on Linux only.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.NotificationProxy.INotificationProxyApi.np_set_notify_callback(iMobileDevice.NotificationProxy.NotificationProxyClientHandle,iMobileDevice.NotificationProxy.NotificationProxyNotifyCallBack,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: This function allows an application to define a callback function that will be called when a notification has been received. It will start a thread that polls for notifications and calls the callback function if a notification has been received. In case of an error condition when polling for notifications - e.g. device disconnect - the thread will call the callback function with an empty notification "" and terminate itself.
member.param: the NP client
pointer to a callback function or NULL to de-register a previously set callback function.
Pointer that will be passed to the callback function as user data. If notify_cb is NULL, this parameter is ignored.
member.returns: NP_E_SUCCESS when the callback was successfully registered, NP_E_INVALID_ARG when client is NULL, or NP_E_UNKNOWN_ERROR when the callback thread could no be created.
member.remarks: Only one callback function can be registered at the same time; any previously set callback function will be removed automatically.

member.param: The client to send to
The notifications that should be observed.
member.returns: NP_E_SUCCESS on success, NP_E_INVALID_ARG when client or notification are NULL, or an error returned by np_plist_send.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.NotificationProxy.NotificationProxyNativeMethods.np_observe_notifications(iMobileDevice.NotificationProxy.NotificationProxyClientHandle,System.IntPtr@)
member.summary: Tells the device to send a notification on specified events.
member.param: The client to send to
Specification of the notifications that should be observed. This is expected to be an array of const char* that MUST have a terminating NULL entry.
member.returns: NP_E_SUCCESS on success, NP_E_INVALID_ARG when client is null, or an error returned by np_observe_notification.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.NotificationProxy.NotificationProxyNativeMethods.np_set_notify_callback(iMobileDevice.NotificationProxy.NotificationProxyClientHandle,iMobileDevice.NotificationProxy.NotificationProxyNotifyCallBack,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: This function allows an application to define a callback function that will be called when a notification has been received. It will start a thread that polls for notifications and calls the callback function if a notification has been received. In case of an error condition when polling for notifications - e.g. device disconnect - the thread will call the callback function with an empty notification "" and terminate itself.
member.param: the NP client
pointer to a callback function or NULL to de-register a previously set callback function.
Pointer that will be passed to the callback function as user data. If notify_cb is NULL, this parameter is ignored.
member.returns: NP_E_SUCCESS when the callback was successfully registered, NP_E_INVALID_ARG when client is NULL, or NP_E_UNKNOWN_ERROR when the callback thread could no be created.
member.remarks: Only one callback function can be registered at the same time; any previously set callback function will be removed automatically.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.Plist.IPlistApi.plist_is_binary(System.String,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Test if in-memory plist data is binary or XML This method will look at the first bytes of plist_data to determine if plist_data contains a binary or XML plist. member.returns: 1 if the buffer is a binary plist, 0 otherwise.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.Plist.PlistApi.plist_is_binary(System.String,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Test if in-memory plist data is binary or XML This method will look at the first bytes of plist_data to determine if plist_data contains a binary or XML plist. This method is not validating the whole memory buffer to check if the content is truly a plist, it's only using some heuristic on the first few bytes of plist_data.
member.param: a pointer to the memory buffer containing plist data.
length of the buffer to read.
member.returns: 1 if the buffer is a binary plist, 0 otherwise.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.Plist.PlistNativeMethods.plist_from_memory(System.String,System.UInt32,iMobileDevice.Plist.PlistHandle@)
member.summary: Import the #plist_t structure from memory data. This method will look at the first bytes of plist_data to determine if plist_data contains a binary or XML plist.

length of the buffer to read.
a pointer to the imported plist.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.Plist.PlistNativeMethods.plist_is_binary(System.String,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Test if in-memory plist data is binary or XML This method will look at the first bytes of plist_data to determine if plist_data contains a binary or XML plist. This method is not validating the whole memory buffer to check if the content is truly a plist, it's only using some heuristic on the first few bytes of plist_data.
member.param: a pointer to the memory buffer containing plist data.
length of the buffer to read.
member.returns: 1 if the buffer is a binary plist, 0 otherwise.

member.summary: Sends an XML plist.
member.param: The property list service client to use for sending.
plist to send
member.returns: PROPERTY_LIST_SERVICE_E_SUCCESS on success, PROPERTY_LIST_SERVICE_E_INVALID_ARG when client or plist is NULL, PROPERTY_LIST_SERVICE_E_PLIST_ERROR when dict is not a valid plist, or PROPERTY_LIST_SERVICE_E_UNKNOWN_ERROR when an unspecified error occurs.

plist to send

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.PropertyListService.IPropertyListServiceApi.property_list_service_receive_plist_with_timeout(iMobileDevice.PropertyListService.PropertyListServiceClientHandle,iMobileDevice.Plist.PlistHandle@,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Receives a plist using the given property list service client with specified timeout. Binary or XML plists are automatically handled.
member.param: The property list service client to use for receiving
pointer to a plist_t that will point to the received plist upon successful return
Maximum time in milliseconds to wait for data.
member.returns: PROPERTY_LIST_SERVICE_E_SUCCESS on success, PROPERTY_LIST_SERVICE_E_INVALID_ARG when connection or *plist is NULL, PROPERTY_LIST_SERVICE_E_PLIST_ERROR when the received data cannot be converted to a plist, PROPERTY_LIST_SERVICE_E_MUX_ERROR when a communication error occurs, or PROPERTY_LIST_SERVICE_E_UNKNOWN_ERROR when an unspecified error occurs.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.PropertyListService.IPropertyListServiceApi.property_list_service_receive_plist(iMobileDevice.PropertyListService.PropertyListServiceClientHandle,iMobileDevice.Plist.PlistHandle@)
member.summary: Receives a plist using the given property list service client. Binary or XML plists are automatically handled. This function is like property_list_service_receive_plist_with_timeout using a timeout of 10 seconds.
member.param: The property list service client to use for receiving
pointer to a plist_t that will point to the received plist upon successful return
member.returns: PROPERTY_LIST_SERVICE_E_SUCCESS on success, PROPERTY_LIST_SERVICE_E_INVALID_ARG when client or *plist is NULL, PROPERTY_LIST_SERVICE_E_PLIST_ERROR when the received data cannot be converted to a plist, PROPERTY_LIST_SERVICE_E_MUX_ERROR when a communication error occurs, or PROPERTY_LIST_SERVICE_E_UNKNOWN_ERROR when an unspecified error occurs.

member.summary: Enable SSL for the given property list service client.
member.param: The connected property list service client for which SSL should be enabled.
member.returns: PROPERTY_LIST_SERVICE_E_SUCCESS on success, PROPERTY_LIST_SERVICE_E_INVALID_ARG if client or client->connection is NULL, PROPERTY_LIST_SERVICE_E_SSL_ERROR when SSL could not be enabled, or PROPERTY_LIST_SERVICE_E_UNKNOWN_ERROR otherwise.

member.returns: PROPERTY_LIST_SERVICE_E_SUCCESS on success, PROPERTY_LIST_SERVICE_E_INVALID_ARG when connection or *plist is NULL, PROPERTY_LIST_SERVICE_E_PLIST_ERROR when the received data cannot be converted to a plist, PROPERTY_LIST_SERVICE_E_MUX_ERROR when a communication error occurs, or PROPERTY_LIST_SERVICE_E_UNKNOWN_ERROR when an unspecified error occurs.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.PropertyListService.PropertyListServiceNativeMethods.property_list_service_receive_plist(iMobileDevice.PropertyListService.PropertyListServiceClientHandle,iMobileDevice.Plist.PlistHandle@)
member.summary: Receives a plist using the given property list service client. Binary or XML plists are automatically handled. This function is like property_list_service_receive_plist_with_timeout using a timeout of 10 seconds.
member.param: The property list service client to use for receiving
pointer to a plist_t that will point to the received plist upon successful return
member.returns: PROPERTY_LIST_SERVICE_E_SUCCESS on success, PROPERTY_LIST_SERVICE_E_INVALID_ARG when client or *plist is NULL, PROPERTY_LIST_SERVICE_E_PLIST_ERROR when the received data cannot be converted to a plist, PROPERTY_LIST_SERVICE_E_MUX_ERROR when a communication error occurs, or PROPERTY_LIST_SERVICE_E_UNKNOWN_ERROR when an unspecified error occurs.

member.summary: Connects to the screenshotr service on the specified device.
member.param: The device to connect to.
The service descriptor returned by lockdownd_start_service.
Pointer that will be set to a newly allocated screenshotr_client_t upon successful return.
member.returns: SCREENSHOTR_E_SUCCESS on success, SCREENSHOTR_E_INVALID ARG if one or more parameters are invalid, or SCREENSHOTR_E_CONN_FAILED if the connection to the device could not be established.
member.remarks: This service is only available if a developer disk image has been mounted.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.Screenshotr.IScreenshotrApi.screenshotr_client_start_service(iMobileDevice.iDevice.iDeviceHandle,iMobileDevice.Screenshotr.ScreenshotrClientHandle@,System.String)
member.summary: Starts a new screenshotr service on the specified device and connects to it.
member.param: The device to connect to.
Pointer that will point to a newly allocated screenshotr_client_t upon successful return. Must be freed using screenshotr_client_free() after use.
The label to use for communication. Usually the program name. Pass NULL to disable sending the label in requests to lockdownd.
member.returns: SCREENSHOTR_E_SUCCESS on success, or an SCREENSHOTR_E_* error code otherwise.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.Screenshotr.IScreenshotrApi.screenshotr_client_free(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Disconnects a screenshotr client from the device and frees up the screenshotr client data.
member.param: The screenshotr client to disconnect and free.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.SyslogRelay.SyslogRelayNativeMethods.syslog_relay_client_new(iMobileDevice.iDevice.iDeviceHandle,iMobileDevice.Lockdown.LockdownServiceDescriptorHandle,iMobileDevice.SyslogRelay.SyslogRelayClientHandle@)
member.summary: Connects to the syslog_relay service on the specified device.
member.param: The device to connect to.
The service descriptor returned by lockdownd_start_service.
Pointer that will point to a newly allocated syslog_relay_client_t upon successful return. Must be freed using syslog_relay_client_free() after use.
member.returns: SYSLOG_RELAY_E_SUCCESS on success, SYSLOG_RELAY_E_INVALID_ARG when client is NULL, or an SYSLOG_RELAY_E_* error code otherwise.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.SyslogRelay.SyslogRelayNativeMethods.syslog_relay_client_start_service(iMobileDevice.iDevice.iDeviceHandle,iMobileDevice.SyslogRelay.SyslogRelayClientHandle@,System.String)
member.summary: Starts a new syslog_relay service on the specified device and connects to it.
member.param: The device to connect to.
Pointer that will point to a newly allocated syslog_relay_client_t upon successful return. Must be freed using syslog_relay_client_free() after use.
The label to use for communication. Usually the program name. Pass NULL to disable sending the label in requests to lockdownd.
member.returns: SYSLOG_RELAY_E_SUCCESS on success, or an SYSLOG_RELAY_E_* error code otherwise.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.SyslogRelay.SyslogRelayNativeMethods.syslog_relay_client_free(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Disconnects a syslog_relay client from the device and frees up the syslog_relay client data.
member.param: The syslog_relay client to disconnect and free.
member.returns: SYSLOG_RELAY_E_SUCCESS on success, SYSLOG_RELAY_E_INVALID_ARG when client is NULL, or an SYSLOG_RELAY_E_* error code otherwise.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.SyslogRelay.SyslogRelayNativeMethods.syslog_relay_start_capture(iMobileDevice.SyslogRelay.SyslogRelayClientHandle,iMobileDevice.SyslogRelay.SyslogRelayReceiveCallBack,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Starts capturing the syslog of the device using a callback. Use syslog_relay_stop_capture() to stop receiving the syslog.
member.param: The syslog_relay client to use
Callback to receive each character from the syslog.
Custom pointer passed to the callback function.
member.returns: SYSLOG_RELAY_E_SUCCESS on success, SYSLOG_RELAY_E_INVALID_ARG when one or more parameters are invalid or SYSLOG_RELAY_E_UNKNOWN_ERROR when an unspecified error occurs or a syslog capture has already been started.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.SyslogRelay.SyslogRelayNativeMethods.syslog_relay_stop_capture(iMobileDevice.SyslogRelay.SyslogRelayClientHandle)
member.summary: Stops capturing the syslog of the device. Use syslog_relay_start_capture() to start receiving the syslog.
member.param: The syslog_relay client to use
member.returns: SYSLOG_RELAY_E_SUCCESS on success, SYSLOG_RELAY_E_INVALID_ARG when one or more parameters are invalid or SYSLOG_RELAY_E_UNKNOWN_ERROR when an unspecified error occurs or a syslog capture has already been started.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.SyslogRelay.SyslogRelayNativeMethods.syslog_relay_receive_with_timeout(iMobileDevice.SyslogRelay.SyslogRelayClientHandle,System.Byte[],System.UInt32,System.UInt32@,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Receives data using the given syslog_relay client with specified timeout.
member.param: The syslog_relay client to use for receiving
Buffer that will be filled with the data received
Number of bytes to receive
Number of bytes received (can be NULL to ignore)
Maximum time in milliseconds to wait for data.
member.returns: SYSLOG_RELAY_E_SUCCESS on success, SYSLOG_RELAY_E_INVALID_ARG when one or more parameters are invalid, SYSLOG_RELAY_E_MUX_ERROR when a communication error occurs, or SYSLOG_RELAY_E_UNKNOWN_ERROR when an unspecified error occurs.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.SyslogRelay.SyslogRelayNativeMethods.syslog_relay_receive(iMobileDevice.SyslogRelay.SyslogRelayClientHandle,System.Byte[],System.UInt32,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Receives data from the service.
member.param: The syslog_relay client
Buffer that will be filled with the data received
Number of bytes to receive
Number of bytes received (can be NULL to ignore)
Maximum time in milliseconds to wait for data.
member.returns: SYSLOG_RELAY_E_SUCCESS on success, SYSLOG_RELAY_E_INVALID_ARG when client or plist is NULL

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.Usbmuxd.IUsbmuxdApi.usbmuxd_get_device_by_udid(System.String,iMobileDevice.Usbmuxd.UsbmuxdDeviceInfo@)
member.summary: Looks up the device specified by UDID and returns device information.
member.param: A device UDID of the device to look for. If udid is NULL, This function will return the first device found.
Pointer to a previously allocated (or static) usbmuxd_device_info_t that will be filled with the device info.
member.returns: 0 if no matching device is connected, 1 if the device was found, or a negative value on error.
member.remarks: This function only considers devices connected through USB. To query devices available via network, use usbmuxd_get_device().

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.Usbmuxd.IUsbmuxdApi.usbmuxd_get_device(System.String,iMobileDevice.Usbmuxd.UsbmuxdDeviceInfo@,System.Int32)
member.summary: Looks up the device specified by UDID with given options and returns device information.
member.param: A device UDID of the device to look for. If udid is NULL, this function will return the first device found.
Pointer to a previously allocated (or static) usbmuxd_device_info_t that will be filled with the device info.

Specifying what device connection types should be considered during lookup. Accepts bitwise or'ed values of usbmux_lookup_options. If 0 (no option) is specified it will default to DEVICE_LOOKUP_USBMUX. To lookup both USB and network-connected devices, pass DEVICE_LOOKUP_USBMUX | DEVICE_LOOKUP_NETWORK. If a device is available both via USBMUX *and* network, it will select the USB connection. This behavior can be changed by adding DEVICE_LOOKUP_PREFER_NETWORK to the options in which case it will select the network connection.
member.returns: 0 if no matching device is connected, 1 if the device was found, or a negative value on error.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.Usbmuxd.IUsbmuxdApi.usbmuxd_connect(System.UInt32,System.UInt16)
member.summary: Request proxy connection to the specified device and port.
member.param: returned in the usbmux_device_info_t structure via usbmuxd_get_device() or usbmuxd_get_device_list().
TCP port number on device, in range 0-65535. common values are 62078 for lockdown, and 22 for SSH.
member.returns: socket file descriptor of the connection, or -1 on error

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.Usbmuxd.IUsbmuxdApi.usbmuxd_disconnect(System.Int32)
member.summary: Disconnect. For now, this just closes the socket file descriptor.
member.param: socket file descriptor returned by usbmuxd_connect()
member.returns: 0 on success, -1 on error.

how many bytes sent
member.returns: 0 on success, a negative errno value otherwise.

member.param: A pointer to an array of usbmuxd_device_info_t that will hold records of the connected devices. The last record is a null-terminated record with all fields set to 0/NULL.

member.remarks: The user has to free the list returned.

member.summary: Frees the device list returned by an usbmuxd_get_device_list call

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.Usbmuxd.UsbmuxdNativeMethods.usbmuxd_get_device_by_udid(System.String,iMobileDevice.Usbmuxd.UsbmuxdDeviceInfo@)
member.summary: Looks up the device specified by UDID and returns device information.
member.param: A device UDID of the device to look for. If udid is NULL, This function will return the first device found.
Pointer to a previously allocated (or static) usbmuxd_device_info_t that will be filled with the device info.
member.returns: 0 if no matching device is connected, 1 if the device was found, or a negative value on error.
member.remarks: This function only considers devices connected through USB. To query devices available via network, use usbmuxd_get_device().

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.Usbmuxd.UsbmuxdNativeMethods.usbmuxd_get_device(System.String,iMobileDevice.Usbmuxd.UsbmuxdDeviceInfo@,System.Int32)
member.summary: Looks up the device specified by UDID with given options and returns device information.
member.param: A device UDID of the device to look for. If udid is NULL, this function will return the first device found.
Pointer to a previously allocated (or static) usbmuxd_device_info_t that will be filled with the device info.

Specifying what device connection types should be considered during lookup. Accepts bitwise or'ed values of usbmux_lookup_options. If 0 (no option) is specified it will default to DEVICE_LOOKUP_USBMUX. To lookup both USB and network-connected devices, pass DEVICE_LOOKUP_USBMUX | DEVICE_LOOKUP_NETWORK. If a device is available both via USBMUX *and* network, it will select the USB connection. This behavior can be changed by adding DEVICE_LOOKUP_PREFER_NETWORK to the options in which case it will select the network connection.
member.returns: 0 if no matching device is connected, 1 if the device was found, or a negative value on error.

member.name: M:iMobileDevice.Usbmuxd.UsbmuxdNativeMethods.usbmuxd_connect(System.UInt32,System.UInt16)
member.summary: Request proxy connection to the specified device and port.
member.param: returned in the usbmux_device_info_t structure via usbmuxd_get_device() or usbmuxd_get_device_list().
TCP port number on device, in range 0-65535. common values are 62078 for lockdown, and 22 for SSH.
member.returns: socket file descriptor of the connection, or -1 on error

member.name: T:iMobileDevice.Utilities
member.summary: Provides methods for retrieving the directory in which the libimobiledevice library and tools are located.

remarks.para: To run the and tools, such as iproxy, we need to know where they are located.

The libimobiledevice library and tools are delivered via the imobiledevice-net NuGet packages on Windows and macOS, and, as a special case, Ubuntu 16.04. On other Linux distributions, you can use the Quamotion PPA at https://launchpad.net/~quamotion/+archive/ubuntu/ppa, or compile from source.

When running in development mode, or via dotnet run, .NET Core does not copy the contents of the NuGet packages to the output directory, but references them instead. In most cases, this is transparent - assemblies, managed and native, are loaded via .NET anyway, so as long as .NET knows where they are, we are good.
For executables, that's a different story. We can't determine the path ourselves, because we don't know, say, the version number, nor is there an API in CoreCLR we can use to query the location.

So we take a detour. The NuGet packages ship with a 'lighthouse' library which contains a get_moduleFileName function, which returns the location of the library. We can call get_moduleFileName from managed code, and determine the directory from there.
Although the same function exists on Windows, Linux and OS X, there are some slight differences. For example, the Windows function uses Unicode, whereas the Unix ones use UTF-8.
